column2: >The Automotive Manufacturing Company of Ethiopia Share Company (AMCE) invites interested and qualified bidders to submit proposals for Janitorial and Cleaning Services.

>Bid Documents: Interested bidders may obtain the bid documents from the Purchasing Logistics Department upon payment of a non-refundable fee of Birr 300.00 (Three Hundred Birr). The documents will be available until the closing date for bids (Monday to Friday), starting from April 7, 2025.

>Eligibility Requirements: Bidders must include the following documents with their proposal a valid Trade License, Tax Clearance Certificate, VAT Registration Certificate, TIN Certificate and any other necessary documents as specified in the Terms of Reference (TOR).
>Submission of Bids: Both the Technical and Financial offers must be sealed separately and labeled ""Bid for Janitorial and Cleaning Services."" Proposals should be submitted to the Purchasing &amp
column3: Logistics Department at AMCE by April 24,2025 at 10:00 A.M.

Bid Security: A bid security of Birr 50,000.00 (Fifty Thousand Birr) is required in the form of a Cashier's Payment Order (CPO) only. The bid opening will take place on April 24, 2025. at 10:30 A.M. in AMCE's Meeting Room.

column2: >Site Visits: Bidders are encouraged to visit the site from Monday to Friday during the following hours:-Morning: 8:30 AM to 12:30 P.M. and Afternoon: 1:30 PM. to 5:30 PM.
>Rights Reserved: AMCE reserves the right to accept or reject any or all bids at its discretion,

column3: Inquiries: For further inquiries, please contact the Manager of the Purchasing Logistics Department at:

column2: >The Automotive Manufacturing Company of Ethiopia Share Company (AMCE Sh. Co.)

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fcdb00d2713835b8077962,Consultancy - Uncategorized,"The Hailemariam & Roman Foundation has received a financing from Agence Française de Dévelopement (""AFD""), intends to procure consultancy service to undertake Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS)",No later than April 29/2025,"Apr 12, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column5: >The Preservation of Maze National Park and its Watershed in Ethiopia
>Expressions of Interest to undertake Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS)

column6: Roman Foundation has received a financing from Agence Française de Dévelopement (""AFD""), and intends to use part of the funds thereof for payments under the following project The Preservation of Maze National Park and its Watershed in Ethiopia.

column5: >The consulting firm's services shall consist of conducting an Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS) in the context of the Maze National Park conservation and community livelihoods project, titled ""The Preservation of Maze National Park and its Watershed in Ethiopia"". This initiative, fully funded by the Agence Française de Développement (AFD). builds on HRF's longstanding commitment to sustainable conservation and community development. Maze National Park, one of the smaller regional parks in South Ethiopia, faces increasing threats from climatic and anthropogenic impacts. The overall long-term goal of the project is to ensure the long-term integrity of Maze National Park for the benefit of Nature and communities. This consultancy assignment is part of a larger five-year donor-funded project (2024-2028), fully supported by the Agence Française de Développement (AFD) and implemented by HRF.

>The AAS aims to assess the current livelihood strategies and activities of local communities surrounding the park, evaluate their impact on its biodiversity, and suggest alternative, sustainable livelihood options that balance the community's economic needs with the park's conservation goals. Specifically, the study will focus on assessing the socio-economic and demographic profiles of the communities. documenting existing agricultural and off-farm activities, and recommending agriculture-related livelihood strategies that will reduce pressure on the park's resources that can be operationalize by HRF and the activities proposed are in line with the already agreed Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF) and the Environmental and Social Management Plan (ESMP) of Maze Project.

>The scope of the services includes collecting and analyzing quantitative and qualitative data from communities within five woredas (Zala, Daramalo, Kucha. Kucha Alpha, and Kamba) and 17 park-adjacent kebeles. The applicant is expected to design data collection tools and conduct surveys, key informant interviews, focus group discussions, and field observations. Furthermore, the applicant will develop a comprehensive report based on the findings, including recommendations for sustainable livelihoods and strategies for mitigating the impact of agricultural activities on the park. The services will also involve collaborating with local government offices. park staff, and the HRF Program team to validate findings and ensure stakeholder engagement throughout the study process. The expected duration of the assignment is approximately 2-3 months, during which the applicant is required to deliver key reports, including an inception report, draft and final AAS report with a brief policy brief and clean datasets for future monitoring and evaluation. The contract size for this study involves multiple expert months, with the applicant responsible for all aspects of fieldwork, data analysis, and report preparation. Applicants with advanced degrees in agronomy, environmental economics, or related fields and experience in conducting similar socio-economic studies in rural settings are encouraged to apply. Familiarity with the local language and culture context is an added advantage]².
Roman Foundation hereby invites Applicants to show their interest in delivering the Services described above.

column4: >This Request for Expressions of Interest is open to:

column5: >Joint Venture between NGO(s) and consulting firm(s)

>Eligibility criteria to AFD financing are specified in sub-clause 1.3 of the ""Procurement Guidelines for AFD-Financed Contracts in Foreign Countries"", available online on AFD's website: http://www.afd.fr.

>The Applicant shall submit only one application, either in its own name or as a member of a Joint Venture (JV). If an Applicant (including any JV member) submits or participates in more than one application, those applications shall be all rejected. However, the same Subconsultant may participate in several applications.
>1.If the project is specified. Otherwise, the identified specific Services shall be named.

>2 The information provided should allow the interested Applicants to decide whether they will submit an expression of interest or not. In particular, an estimate of the contract size should be indicated (number of experts-months or budget available, but not both).

column4: >If the Applicant is a JV, the expression of interest shall include:
>a copy of the JV Agreement entered into by all members, or

column5: >a letter of intent to execute a JV Agreement, signed by all members together with a copy of the Agreement proposal.
>In the absence of this document, the other members will be considered as Subconsultants.
>Experiences and qualifications of Subconsultants are not taken into account in the evaluation of the applications.

>Interested Applicants must provide information evidencing that they are qualified and experienced to perform those Services. For that purpose, documented evidence of recent and similar services shall be submitted.

column4: >Determination of the similarity of the experiences will be based on:
>The contracts size: Sound experience leading surveys covering wide geographic areas and sampling more than 400 households.
>The nature of the Services: Agrarian Analysis, Socio-economic studies, and Livelihood studies:

column5: >The technical area and expertise: The consulting firm must have team experts with an advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in agronomy, environmental economics, development economics, agri-business and value chain, development studies, or other relevant fields and adequate and dependable work experience conducting Agrarian Analysis, preferably done on rural/agricultural-related livelihood diversification. working with the community around park/ protected areas and conducting surveys, FGD and KII with the community, and experience in working with similar projects with different local and international NGOs are additions. Working in national parks or protected areas in rural settings (e.g. quantitative and qualitative field assessments, participatory rural appraisals, livelihoods diversification). The consulting firm must have experts who have strong communication and presentation skills in multiple sets of quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis using different statistical packages (Stata and SPSS), and a proven command of written and spoken English: familiarity with the project area language is an added advantage.
>The location: Experience working in national parks, or protected areas in Ethiopia or a comparable context and local communities living near national parks and protected areas.
>At least 5 years of relevant working experience in Ethiopia and information collection in rural areas, particularly in national parks and protected areas.
>Expertise in data analysis tools and methodologies
>An application that does not meet any of these requirements will be rejected.]

column6: Roman Foundation] will shortlist a maximum of six (6) Applicants, to whom the Request for Proposals to carry out the Services shall be sent.

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fccada80d88740d60fdae7,Pharmaceuticals and Medical Supplies,"The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, hereby seeks expressions of interest (EOI) from qualified and experienced vendors for the Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA",25 April 2025,"Apr 13, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >This notice is placed by UNECA. The accuracy, reliability and completeness of the contents of furnished information is the responsibility of United Nations Economic Commission for Africa. You are therefore requested to direct all queries regarding this EOI to United Nations Economic Commission for Africa using the fax number or e-mail address provided below.

>Title of the EOI: Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA
Date of this EOI: 10 April 2025
column5:
Closing Date for Receipt of EOI: 25 April 2025
EOI Number: EOIUNECA23570
Beneficiary Country/Territory: Ethiopia
Commodity/Service category: Health Services
Address EOI response by fax or e-mail to the Attention of: Ms. Etsegenet Teka/ Mr.Ali Assaad / Ms. Aster Zewde
Fax Number: N/A
E-mail Address: etsegenet.argaw@un.org

column2: >The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, hereby seeks expressions of interest (EOI) from qualified and experienced vendors for the Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA.

>Interested firms will be invited to the tender by an ""Invitation To Bid"" (ITB) at a later stage. This tender envisages a selection-capable bidding firm for the Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA.

>The United Nations Healthcare Center (UNHCC) looks to procure unavailable essential emergency medicines from pharmaceutical wholesalers and community pharmacies. The initiative aims in this procurement include prevent stockouts and ensure the continuous provision of high quality healthcare services to UNHCC beneficiaries.
>The continuous availability of essential emergency medicines by establishing contracts is: To minimize stockouts and ensure the steady availability of essential medicines.
>To enhance the responsiveness of the pharmacy unit to the needs of healthcare providers. To improve overall healthcare delivery and patient satisfaction among staff.
>Must be legally registered and licensed to operate as a pharmaceutical wholesaler, or community pharmacy.
>Must possess all necessary licenses, permits, and registrations required by the relevant national drug regulatory authority.

column3: Medical supplies are legally imported or manufactured, with all required documentation (e.g., import licenses, certificates of origin)&nbsp

column2: >The vendor must maintain high standards of quality control and assurance throughout their supply chain. Medicines must meet all relevant quality standards and specifications set by the local regulatory authority.
>Must have a proven track record of supplying high-quality, authentic, and safe medications. Capacity and Reliability:
>The vendor must demonstrate the capacity to consistently supply the required medicines in the quantities and timeframe specified by the UNHCC.
>Must demonstrate a reliable and consistent supply chain to ensure uninterrupted availability of medications.
>Must maintain adequate stock levels to meet the UNHCC's anticipated demand.
>The vendor should provide information on their stock levels and supply chain capabilities.

>Please note that the ECA is precluded from entering into contract with a firm that is not registered with ECA. Those interested in responding to this EOI but not currently registered as vendors with ECA, are encouraged to register before submission of the EOI in the United Nations Global Market Place (UNGM). Further details may be obtained by visiting https://www.ungm.org/Vendor/Registration . In order to be eligible for UNGM registration, please make sure to declare in writing the prerequisite for eligibility criteria itemized from A-F as included in EOI instructions attached.

column4: >Information on tendering for the UN Procurement System is available free of charge at the following address: https://www.ungm.org/Public/Notice

Your company (as well as any parent, subsidiary of affiliate companies) is not under formal investigation, nor have been sanctioned within the preceding three (3) years, by any national authority of a United Nations Member State for engaging or having engaged in proscribed practices, including but not limited to: corruption, fraud, coercion, collusion, obstruction, or any other unethical practice

Your company does not employ, or anticipate employing, any person(s) who is, or has been a UN staff member within the last year, if said UN staff member has or had prior professional dealings with the Vendor in his/her capacity as UN staff member within the last three years of service with the UN (in accordance with UN post-employment restrictions published in ST/SGB/2006/15).

Your company undertakes not to engage in proscribed practices (including but not limited to: corruption, fraud, coercion, collusion, obstruction, or any other unethical practice), with the UN or any other party, and to conduct business in a manner that averts any financial, operational, reputational or other undue risk to the UN.

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fcc2c0d87e942c5302d494,Construction and Real Estate,"The Ministry of Water and Energy now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the Construction, Operation, and Maintenance of the Fecal Sludge and Septage Treatment Plant for Bahir Dar Town, 552km north-western of Addis Ababa","29 May 2025, 10:00 pm.","Apr 13, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"<div style=""text-align:center
• Project: Ethiopia Second Urban Water Supply and Sanitation Project
• Contract Title: Construction, Operation, and Maintenance of Fecal Sludge and Septage

column2: >The Government of The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Second Urban Water Supply and Sanitation Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds toward payments under the contract for the Construction, Operation, and Maintenance of Fecal Sludge and Septage Treatment Plant for Bahir Dar Town

>The Ministry of Water and Energy now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the Construction, Operation, and Maintenance of the Fecal Sludge and Septage Treatment Plant for Bahir Dar Town, 552km north-western of Addis Ababa. The construction and operation period is 18 months. The work consists of Preliminary and General Items, Receiving Chamber/ Screen unit, Construction of Settling Tank, Sludge drying bed, Transfer Station, Anaerobic Ponds, Constructed Wetland feeding station, Constructed Wetland, Chlorination Unit, Service Building, Sludge Storage Area, Road Works, Water Supply for FSTP, Testing, Commissioning, Operation &amp
column3: Maintenance, and Electro Mechanical Works, Margin of preference applicable

Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Bidding procedures as specified in the World Bank's Guidelines: Procurement of Goods, Works and Non-Consulting Services under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits &
column4: Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 (""Procurement Guidelines""), and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the Procurement Guidelines. In addition, please refer to paragraphs 1.6 and 1.7 setting forth the World Bank's policy on conflict of interest. Bidders shall fulfill the following qualification requirements: (i) Financial capability: The Bidder shall demonstrate that it has access to, or has available, liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means (independent of any contractual advance payment) sufficient to meet the construction cash flow requirements estimated as ETB 400,000,000 (ETB Four Hundred Million) or US$ 3,300,000 (US$ three Million three hundred thousand) for the subject contract (s) net of the Bidders other commitments. (ii) Minimum average annual construction turnover of ETB 2,500,000,000(ETB Two Billion and five Hundred Million) or US$ 20,000,000 (US$ twenty Million), calculated as total certified payments received for and/or completed within the last 5(Five) contracts in progress years, divided by 5(Five)years, starting 1st January 2020. (iii) Specific Experience: A minimum number of similar contracts specified below that have been satisfactorily and substantially completed as a prime contractor, joint venture member, management contractor or sub-contractor8 between 1st January 2020 and application submission deadline: (i) One (&nbsp
column5: I) contract with a minimum value of ETB 1,800,000,000 (ETB one Billion Eight Hundred Million) or USD 15,000,000 (US$ fifteen Million) OR - (ii) two (2) contracts each with minimum value of ETB 950,000,000 (ETB Nine Hundred fifty Million) or USD 7,500,000 (US$ Seven Million five Hundred Thousand) and (iv) for the above and any other contracts completed and under implementation as prime contractor, joint venture member, management contractor or sub-contractor on or after the first day of the calendar year during the period stipulated in 4.2 (a) above, a minimum construction experience in the following key activities successfully completed: Construction of Wastewater Treatment plant/ Fecal Sludge Treatment plant/Water Supply Treatment Plant with the minimum treatment capacity of 1000 m3/day/ experience in construction of water supply schemes at least to the size of 10,000m3/day.

column3: Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Bidding procedures as specified in the World Bank's Guidelines: Procurement of Goods, Works and Non- Consulting Services under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits &amp

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fce9ccd87e942c5302d496,Consultancy - Investment and Asset Management,The Development Bank of Ethiopia (DBE) like to receive expressions of interest (EOIs) from legally formed consulting firms to conduct Consultancy Service for the Development of Wholesale Islamic Financing Mechanisms,"May 08, 2025 at 4:00 P.M","Apr 13, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"
• Assignment:: Consultancy Service for the Development of Wholesale Islamic Financing Mechanisms
• Selection Method: Quality and Cost Based Selection (QCBS)

column2: >The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia has received financing from the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) for the Rural Financial Intermediation Program III (RUFIP-III), under which a portion of the funding will be utilized towards qualified payments on assignments for the consultancy services.

>The Development Bank of Ethiopia (DBE) is one of the state-owned financial institutions engaged in providing project finance for projects and lease financing for small and medium enterprises (SMEs) to support the overall economic development of the country.

>DBE has received finance from International Fund for Agriculture Development (IFAD) towards the cost of RUFIP Il and intends to apply part of the proceeds for the requirement of consulting service, for which this REOI is issued.

>DBE would like to receive expressions of interest (EOIs) from legally formed consulting firms to conduct Consultancy Service for the Development of Wholesale Islamic Financing Mechanisms. The terms of reference contain additional information about these consulting services.

>To develop mechanisms, policies, and procedures for the external Fund and Credit Management Directorate and Development Bank of Ethiopia /DBE/ to secure Sharia-compliant funds from global partners using licensed resource mobilization instruments and innovative sharia compliant products:

>To establish a framework for the Extemal Fund and Credit. Management Directorate to provide Sharia-compliant wholesale financing to partner financial institutions in collaboration with DBE's Interest-Free Banking Directorate, while ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements
>To advise on the necessary accounting records and transaction management for DBE's Interest-Free Banking operations, including the integration with the bank's overall financial system:
>Develop an operational manual for DBE wholesale Interest Free financing intended for participating financial institutions.
>The objective of the EOI is to hire consulting firms who will be invited to submit proposals.

>The attention of interested consultants is drawn to the IFAD's Anti-Money Laundering and Countering Terrorist Financing Policy, as well as the Revised IFAD Policy on Preventing Fraud and Corruption in its Activities and Operations. The latter contains IFAD's restrictions on prohibited practices. In addition, as detailed in its IFAD Policy on Preventing and Responding to Sexual Harassment. Sexual Exploitation, and Abuse, IFAD strives to ensure a safe working environment free of harassment, including sexual harassment, and free of sexual exploitation and abuse (SEA) in its activities and operations.

>Interested consultants shall not have any actual, potential or reasonably perceived conflict of interest. Consultants with an actual, potential or reasonably perceived conflict of interest shall be disqualified unless otherwise explicitly approved by the Fund. Consultants are considered to have a conflict of interest if they
>a) Have a relationship that provides them with undue or undisclosed information about or influence over the selection process and the execution of the contract, or
>b) Have a business or family relationship with a member of the client's&nbsp
column3: board of directors or its personnel, the Fund or its personnel, or any other individual that was, has been or might reasonably be directly or indirectly involved in any part of

column2: >(ii)the selection process for this procurement, or (ii) execution of the contract. Consultants have an ongoing obligation to disclose any situation of actual, potential cr reasonably perceived confict of interest during preparation of the EOL. the selection process or the contract execution. Fallure to properly disclose any of said situations may lead to appropriate actions, including the disqualification of the consultant, the termination of the contract and any other as appropriate under the IFAD Policy on Preventing Fraud and Corruption in its Projects and Operations.
>The consultant will be selected in accordance with the procedures set out in IFAD procurement handbook and national procurement directive. The followings are Details of EOI evaluation criteria:

column3: >Bidder must submit at least Two Certificates of satisfactory execution (Testimony) of contracts related to the assignment provided by contracting parties to the contracts successfully completed in the course of the last [insert required number of years) five (5) years.
>Presence of long-term staff in the consulting firm with hands-on experience in the development of Wholesale Islamic Financing Mechanisms
>Long term profitability as is evidenced by&nbsp
column4: positive net income in each of the past 3 years (2022, 2023 and 2024).
2023 and 2024 of at least 200,000.00 ETB or equivalent:

column2: >Consultants may associate with other firms to enhance their qualifications but should indicate clearly whether the association is in the form of a joint venture and/or a sub-consultancy. In the case of a joint venture, all the partners in the joint venture shall be jointly and severally liable for the entire contract, if selected.

b) Certified copy of valid Tax Identification Number (TIN):

g) CVs and credential of the long term staff

column2: >The final selection of the organization to conduct the study shall be based on a Quality- and Cost-Based Selection (QCBS) method through Request for Proposals.

>On all pages of the EOI proposal document, the organization's stamp should be sealed near the authorized signatory and all pages should be numbered, dated, signed, and stamped. The application must be signed by an authorized individual. Additional sheets that the applicant must attach should be numbered and submitted as a package with a signed letter. The applicant may provide any additional information he or she believes is necessary to demonstrate his or her ability to perform the proposed consultancy service.

>Interested consultant may obtain further information from DBE Head Office. Procurement Directorate, Tower III. 1st floor. Tel. +251 11 553 8944 or +251 11 550 6020. ext. 343/204: Fax +251 11 553 7982.

>The EOI and all documentations shall be submitted in English, One original and one copy. Expressions of interest (EOIs) shall be submitted into the tender box prepared for this purpose on or before May 08, 2025 at 4:00 P.M (in the afternoon) at the Development Bank of Ethiopia Head Office Tower 1, Ground floor.
>The applicants shall submit EOIs as per the formats.&nbsp

column2:
>INVITATIONS FOR BID FOR PROCUREMENT OF
PROJECT VEHICLES (COROLLA
cross 1.81 hybrid and or Grand Vitara GLX 4WD 1462h)

>ዜጎች ለዜጎች የልማት ድርጅት-known in English as Citizens to Citizens (C2C) Development Organization, is a national civil society organization registered under Proclamation No. 1113/2019 in December 2021. Operating in the Amhara and Southern Ethiopia regions, C2C's mission is to develop and deliver humanitarian assistance that strengthens the values, dignity, capacities, and interconnectedness of Ethiopians to help one another during crises and collectively address root causes of vulnerability. The organization's work emphasizes compassion, mutual support and community empowerment. C2C is seeking for reliable and potential suppliers for procurement of Project Vehicle(s) who can fulfill the requirements as per the specifications provided in the full Invitations for bid documents.

Interested bidders must submit copies of their valid and renewed trade license, suppliers' registration certificate, Tax Identification Number, VAT registration certificate, Authorized dealers' certificate in Ethiopia &amp

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fceeba1950a9bdbc05a5b3,Social Services,TradeMark Africa (TMA) would like to invite interested eligible and qualified firms for Implementing Improved Resilience and Market Access for Women in Trade in Ethiopia and Design and Implementation of The Ethiopia Export Development Program,No Specific Closing Date and Time,"Apr 13, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >TradeMark Africa (TMA) is a leading African Aid-for-Trade organisation that was established in 2010. TMA aims to grow intra-African trade and increase Africa's share in global trade, while helping make trade more pro-poor and more environmentally sustainable. Our focus on reducing the cost and time of trading across borders through enhanced trade policy, better trade infrastructure, standards that work for businesses, greater use of digital innovations and a focus on creating trade access for vulnerable groups, has contributed to substantially lower cargo transit times through improved border efficiency, and reduced trade barriers.

>TMA recently rebranded from TradeMark East Africa (TMEA), reflecting our ambitions to serve partners in driving continental-wide trade gains, and are expanding from East and the Horn of Africa to Southern and West Africa. TMA operates on a not-for-profit basis and is funded by institutional and philanthropic development partners. TMA works closely with regional and continental intergovernmental organisations, national Governments, the private sector, and civil society organisations to deliver results that drive shared prosperity and reduce poverty. For more information, please visit www.trademarkafrica.com
>TMA would like to invite interested eligible and qualified firms to participate in the following tender opportunity:
>Title: Implementing Improved Resilience and Market Access for Women in Trade in Ethiopia
>Title: Design and Implementation of The Ethiopia Export Development Program
>https://www.trademarkafrica.com/procurement/ All queries quoting the above Tender Title and Number should be emailed to
column3: procurement@trademarkafrica.com. The closing date for submission is per indicated in the respective tender documents.

column2: >Interested, qualified and eligible bidders should submit bids in line with the bidding instructions in the tender document.

>TMA cannot answer any query relating to this tender 7 days or less prior to the submission deadline.

column2: >Development Expertise Center (DEC) is a national Civil Society Organization (CSO) dedicated to the well-being of children. DEC has been implementing a wide range of programs and projects in various regions of Ethiopia, including Afar, Oromia, Amara, Benishangual Gumuz, Gambela, Tigray, and Addis Ababa. These programs focus on education, protection, employable skill development, gender and life skill development, humanitarian response and coordination, WASH, livelihoods, and shelter construction, both in development and emergency settings

>To improve access to pre-primary education and promote a safe learning environment, DEC, through the KNH SEND Children project. wants to construct a learning block (7m x 6m) for pre-primary learning classes in Dubti District, Afar Region.

Mao-Komo Special Worada finance office invites eligible bidder with water well drilling license level-5 and above which have renewed trade license, vat registration certificate, certificate of competence, trade license registration, supplier registration certificate of the 2017 for Drilling, and Construction 21 shallow wells.

column2: >3.The Mao-Komo Woreda finance office now invites sealed bids from qualified eligible bidders for the construction of the following numbers of items as indicated in each lots.

column2: >4. The bid documents must be submitted in a seated envelop in the tender box located at minister of water Addis Ababa

>5. An interested bidder can purchase a complete set of bidding documents in English from the day that the advertisement appears in the Ethiopian Herald newspaper from Benishangul Gumuz Region Mao-Komo Special Worada finance office, at Ministry of water and Energy leompound Addis Ababa for 11th calendar days from the last advertisement date of this notice on the Ethiopian herald during normal working hours upon payment of a non-refundable fee of Ethiopian Birr 2000.00 (Two Thousand Birr Only). The Method of payment will be in cash.

>6. The eligible bidders are expected to go through the bidding document and submit original and copies of their technical and financial proposals as well as bid security in à separate wax sealed envelopes addressed to Benishangul Gumuz region Mao-Komo Special Worada finance office on or before 2:30 PM on or before 11th calendar days from the last advertisement date notice on the Ethiopian Herald and bids shall be opened at 3:00 PM at the ministry of water and energy compound hall, Addis Ababa. Both technical and financial document will open and announced within 6 days at water and energy bureau Assosa. But after technical document evaluation is responsive the financial document will open at the same place (Benishangul Gumuz region water, and energy resource development Bureau meeting hall).

>7. Bidding will be conducted in accordance with the opening tender procedures contained in the Public Procurement Proclamation of the Government of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia and is open to all eligible bidders. Bids shall be valid for a period of sixty (60) days ard Bid Security shall be Valid for 60 Days after Bid opening. All bids must be accompanied by a bid security, in an acceptable (CPO or bank guarantee) form amounting to 500,000 Birr (Five Hundred Thousand Birr Only) per lot and they shall be delivered to ""The Benishangul Gumuz Regional State Mao-Komo Special Worada finance office at ministry of water and energy compound hall (Addis Ababa) ""on 2:30 PM on or before 11th calendar days from the last advertisement date of this notice on the Ethiopian herald and the technical bids shall be opened at 3:00 PM at the same date &
column3: address in the presence of the bidders who wish to attend. Electronic bidding will not be permitted. Late bids will be rejected. If the 11th Calendar day is holyday, it will be on the next working day.

column2: >8. The award will be decided on a lot by lot basis. Bidders can bid for only in one lot (this is for a bidder who have only one drilling rig machine). But, bidders who have two and more drilling rig machines can bid both lots at the same time and the bid document to be submitted in separate for each lot. Bidders who have only one drilling rig machine and participate in both lot shall be rejected.

>9. Bidders shall be use Bill of quantities (BOQ) for shallow wells as stated on the bid document/tender bid which the procuring body offer BOQs with in respect to the lot number where they to be participated. If not it shall be rejected.

>10 Bidders should provide qualification requirements which include: (i) ownership (or existing lease agreement from official (Justice)) of a suitable drilling rig, (ii) completion of drilling and construction of at least one contracts of similar work in each of the last One year, (iii) annual turnover of 1.5 times the bid value in each of the last two years, (iv) liquid assets of at least 1/3 the contract value and (v) experienced drilling team. Additional details are provided in the Bidding Documents.
>11. The Benishangul Gumuz Regional State Mao-Komo Special Worada finance office reserve the right to reject all or part of the bid.

>በኢንተርፕራይዝ የተደራጁ ማህበራት /ድርጅቶች የተደራጁበትን ሙሉ ማስረጃ ኮፒ ማቅረብ ይጠበቅባቸዋል።
>ዩኒቨርስቲው የተሻለ አማራጭ ካገኘ ጨረታውን ሙሉ በሙሉ ወይም በከፊል የመሰረዝ መብቱ የተጠበቀ ነው።
>ማንኛውም ተጫራጭ ግልፅ እና ተነባቢ የሆኑ ኦርጂናል ሰነዶቹን ማያያዝ የሚጠበቅበት ሲሆን የቀረበው ማስረጃ የማይነበብ ወይም ግልጽ ካልሆነ ከውድድር ያሰርዛል።
>ማንኛውም ተጫራች ጨረታው በተዘጋ በ30፡00 ደቂቃ ውስጥ የጨረታ መክፈቻ ሚስጥር ቁጥር (key share) ከሲስተሙ ላይ ማስቀመጥ ወይም መሙላት አለበት፤ ካላስቀመጠ ከውድድር ውጭ ያስደርጋል።
>ማንኛውም ተጫራጭ የታክስ ክሪላንስ ማረጋገጫ ሰነድ ማቅረብ የሚኖርበት ሲሆን የታክስ ክሪላንስ የማያስፈልገው ከሆነ እንደማያስፈልገው ከሚመለከተው መ/ቤት ማቅረብ አለበት፤ ካላቀረበ ከውድድር ውጭ ያስደርጋል።

column2: >REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES-FIRMS' SELECTION) FEDERAL DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF ETHIOPIA MINISTRY OF WATER AND ENERGY Project Title: Energy Source Demand and Consumption Assessment Project Reference No.: QCBS-MOWE-ESDCS-002/2024 - Re-bid

>To assess the current and forecast future Energy Source Demand and consumption in the Sectors (Transport, Industry, Household, service and Agriculture) that contribute to the sustainable development goal. Thereby, offer evidence based strategic interventions areas that show the status of sectors consumption and Demand needs, and it used to increase the supply, access and energy efficiency improvement options.

>The scope of the Energy sources demand and consumption assessment will cover sectors (households, Service Sector, industries, Agriculture and transports) at national level. The Assessment expected to be completed within 1 year. But, the task presented under the two main tasks: Task 1) The main Tasks/Activities of the Consultant. Task 2) Detail brief activities and Expectations from the consultant.

column1: Please note that the detail Objective and Scope of the assignment shall be given in the TOR through the website.

column2: >The total duration of the assignment will be 360 calendar days with possible extension based on performance. The Independent Verification will be conducted as per the request of the claims by the grantee of the project with a total estimated input of 12 man-months.

column1: The Ministry of Water and Energy now invites eligible consulting firms (""Consultants"") to indicate their interest in providing the Services. The Evaluation of Full Technical Proposal is:
I. Core business and years in business

column2: Relevant Experience of the firm in the field of assignment (Specific Experience)

column1: III. Organizational. managerial and technical capabilities of the firm.

A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the QCSB method set out in the Procurement Regulation (PPA). column2: >ማንኛውም ተጫራጭ የጨረታ ማስከበርያውን ኦርጂናል የጨረታ መክፈቻው ቀን ከመድረሱ አንድ ቀን ቀደም በሎ ደባርቅ ዩኒቨርስቲ ወይም አዲስ አበባ ጉርድ ሾላ ቶፕ ቴን ሆቴል ጀርባ የውሃ ልማት ፈንድ ቢሮ አጠገብ ከሚገኘው ማስተባበርያ ፅ/ቤታቸን ድረስ በአካል በመቅረብ ማስረከብ አለበት ሆኖም ግን ማቅረብ ካልቻለ ከውድድር ውጭ ይደረጋል።
>በኢንተርፕራይዝ የተደራጁ ማህበራት /ድርጅቶች የተደራጁበትን ሙሉ ማስረጃ ኮፒ ማቅረብ ይጠበቅባቸዋል።
>ዩኒቨርስቲው የተሻለ አማራጭ ካገኘ ጨረታውን ሙሉ በሙሉ ወይም በከፊል የመሰረዝ መብቱ የተጠበቀ ነው።
>ማንኛውም ተጫራጭ ግልፅ እና ተነባቢ የሆኑ ኦርጂናል ሰነዶቹን ማያያዝ የሚጠበቅበት ሲሆን የቀረበው ማስረጃ የማይነበብ ወይም ግልጽ ካልሆነ ከውድድር ያሰርዛል።
>ማንኛውም ተጫራች ጨረታው በተዘጋ በ30፡00 ደቂቃ ውስጥ የጨረታ መክፈቻ ሚስጥር ቁጥር (key share) ከሲስተሙ ላይ ማስቀመጥ ወይም መሙላት አለበት፤ ካላስቀመጠ ከውድድር ውጭ ያስደርጋል።
>ማንኛውም ተጫራጭ የታክስ ክሪላንስ ማረጋገጫ ሰነድ ማቅረብ የሚኖርበት ሲሆን የታክስ ክሪላንስ የማያስፈልገው ከሆነ እንደማያስፈልገው ከሚመለከተው መ/ቤት ማቅረብ አለበት፤ ካላቀረበ ከውድድር ውጭ ያስደርጋል።
>አሸናፊው ድርጅት ዩኒቨርሲቲው በመግባት ሙሉውን ስራ በመስራት ገጥሞ ማስረከብ አለበት።

column2: >1. Ethio telecom invites all interested and eligible bidders by this Open National Competitive Bid (NCB) for the procurement of DIFFERENT TYPES OF TIRES, TUBES AND FLAPS with RFQ No 4274561. The Bid remains floating from April 24, 2025, to May 14, 2025.

>Bid documents can be obtained from the following web sites www.2merkato.com, www.extratenders.com and www.afrotender. com upon payment of a non-refundable fee of Birr 100.00 (Birr One hundred only) by using tele birr payment platform. In addition, if you are interested to be on the Supplier list of Ethio telecom please register using the following link or copy and paste the link on a browser
>2. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from Ethio telecom's website (i.e. https://www.Ethiotelecom.et/tender/ ).
>2.1 Sealed bids marked as: Tender for the Supply of procurement DIFFERENT TYPES OF TIRES, TUBES AND FLAPS
column3: with RFQ No. 4274561 be addressed to

column2: >2.2 Bid proposal will be received at Ethio telecom, Head Quarter 2nd Floor, Room No 211B, Before or on May 14, 2025 5:00 P.M. Bids presented by any bidder after the closing date shall not be accepted.

>3. Bids received in time and fulfilling the other formalities shall be opened in the presence of interested bidders or their legal representatives on May 15, 2025, at 10:00 A.M, at Ethio telecom, Head Quarter 2nd Floor, Room No.210.

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fe1ff01a8da05cb10555c2,Surveying and Geospatial,"The Ministry of Agriculture now invites sealed bids from eligible entities bidders for the provision of Total Station, Hand GPS and Levelling",16 May 2025 10:00 AM EAT.,"Apr 15, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >1. The Ministry of Agriculture, Participatory Agriculture &amp
column3: Climate Transformation Programme (PACT) has received financing from the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) and intends to apply a part of the proceeds of the financing to this purchase. The use of any IFAD financing shall be subject to IFAD's approval, pursuant to the terms and conditions of the financing agreement, as well as IFAD's rules, policies, and procedures. IFAD and its officials, agents, and employees shall be held harmless from and against all suits, proceedings, claims, demands, losses, and liability of any kind or nature brought by any party in connection with the Participatory Agriculture &amp

Climate Transformation (PACT) initiative focuses on reducing poverty and improving the resilience of targeted rural households. The Programme Development Objective (PDO) is to empower 150,000 rural households, encompassing men, women, youth, and persons with disabilities (PWDs) in selected kebeles, to attain sustainable enhancements in their income, food and nutrition security, while also bolstering their resilience to various shocks.

column2: >This Programme will be executed across nine regional states, namely Amhara, Oromia, Southern Ethiopia, Central Ethiopia, South West Ethiopia, Sidama, Afar, Tigray, and Somali, over seven years, concluding in 2030.
>3. The Purchaser now invites sealed bids from eligible entities bidders for the provision of&nbsp

>to be delivered to the Ministry of Agriculture's head office within 60 calendar days. More details on these goods and related services are provided in the schedule of requirements in this bidding document.

>4. This IFB is open to all eligible bidders who wish to respond. Subject to restrictions noted in the bidding document, eligible entities may associate with other bidders to enhance their capacity to successfully carry out the procurement.

>5. Bidding will be conducted using the national competitive bidding (NCB) method, the evaluation procedure for which is described in this bidding document, by the IFAD Procurement Handbook which is provided at www.ifad.org / project-procurement. The NCB process, as described, will include a review and verification of qualifications and past performance, including a reference check, prior to the contract award.
>6. Please note that a pre-bid conference will not be held as described in the bid data sheet (BDS), Section III of the bidding document.

>7. Bidders interested in submitting a bid shall purchase the bidding document against payment of a non-refundable fee of 1,000 Birr to the Ministry of Agriculture, Account Number: 1000009144009 at the Commercial Bank of Ethiopia (CBE).. Bidding documents can be obtained by sending an e-mail or letter, giving full contact details of the bidder, to the following point of contact. This will ensure that themederreceive updates regarding this bidding document.
>8. Bids must be delivered to the address and in the manner specified in the bid data sheet-instructions to bidders 23.2, no later than 16 May 2025 10:00 AM EAT.

>9. Bidders shall be aware that late bids will not be accepted under any circumstance and will be returned unopened at the written request and cost of the bidder. All bids must be accompanied by a bid security or bid-securing declaration (as required) in the manner and amount specified in the bid data sheet.
>10. Please note that electronic bids shall not be accepted.

column5: >Ethiopian Airlines Group intends to invite qualified Category 1 General and Road Contractors (GC/RC-1) for Design-Build of Kebri Dhar Airfield Reconstruction, Access Road and parking area rehabilitation Project. The bid is open to all local bidders and international bidders with local trade license to participate on national competitive bids.
>Any legally established bidders in Ethiopia with renewed Trade License for the current year, Valid Tax clearance, VAT registration certificate, Taxpayer Identification Certificate (TIN) &amp

column5: >Bidders who are currently engaged in two (2) or more projects with Ethiopian Airlines Group, where the completion percentage of each project is less than 70%, are not permitted to participate in this tender.

>Bidders should deposit non-refundable ETB 100.00 (One Hundred Birr) to the nearby Commercial Bank of Ethiopia (CBE) referring this tender number SSNT-T533 to Ethiopian Airlines Group Account Number 1000006958277(E- 99). Bidders shall email the scanned copy of the deposit slip to the below address and will get the Tender document by return Email.Bidders shall furnish bid security in the form of CPO or unconditional and irrevocable bank guarantee with an amount of ETB 500,000.00 (Five Hundred Thousand Birr) in the name of Ethiopian Airlines Group. Any insurance guarantee shall not be accepted. Bids shall be valid for a period of One Hundred Fifty (150) Calendar Days after tender opening.

>The sealed bid proposals must be submitted in separate envelopes i.e., the (Technical Proposal, Financial Offer, and Bid Security) and one outer envelope, duly marking the inner envelopes as ""ORIGINAL"" and ""COPIES"" document and be delivered to Ethiopian Airlines Group, Strategic Sourcing Non-Technical office on/ before May 14, 2025, at 11:00 AM. column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fe3e60ff823355ba099550,Textiles and Apparel,SOS Children’s Villages in Ethiopia want to procure Sewing and General Maintenance and Workshop tools,On 24 April 2025 03:00 PM.,"Apr 15, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"
column3:
LOCATION: SOS CHILDREN’S VILLAGE’S Ethiopia
ISSUANCE DATE: 15 April 2025
SUBMISSION DEADLINE: 24 April

column2: >SOS Children’s Villages in Ethiopia is a member of the International Federation of SOS Children’s Villages. It is a non-political, non-religious social development organization focused on the well-being and development of children. It was founded in 1974 and has since been a development partner to the government of Ethiopia, and it has positively impacted the lives of thousands of children, families, and communities.

>We operate in seven locations: Addis Ababa, Bahir Dar, Mekelle, Jimma, Harar, Hawassa, and Gode , with additional satellite projects in each Region and the National Office in Addis Ababa. FOR one of its projects, named STEP , we want to procure Sewing and General Maintenance and Workshop tools hereby invite potential suppliers to submit their offer according to the below item Details, Instructions to Bidders, and General Terms and Conditions of Purchase as described hereunder:

column1: • Eligibility Documents – Valid Business License (E.C. 2017 Renewed License, Taxpayer Registration Certificate (TIN), and VAT Registration Certificate.
• Company profile listing the bidders’ address, branches, structure, etc.
• Evidence of past satisfactory performance on the provision of similar supplies.
• Please ensure that the brand names and detailed specifications of the items are clearly stated in the Bid.

column2: >We do not base our evaluation solely on the total price but rather on procuring each item at the lowest cost available, as bidders may not necessarily have all the listed items. Therefore, please provide a quote only for the items currently available in stock.

>The tender document must be submitted in a sealed envelope, bearing an official company seal, and marked by the “bidders’ name, address, and the tender reference number and title as stated above. Tenders must be submitted in the bid box prepared for these purposes at SOS Children’s Villages in Ethiopia National office in Addis Ababa, located at Bole Atlas in front of Mado Hotel, (Tel: 011 661 1655) or before 24 April 2025 03:00 PM.
>The SOS Children’s Villages in Ethiopia Procurement Committee will open tender responses on 25 April 2025 at its discretion.
>SOS CVE reserves the right to accept or reject this bid, in partial or in its entirety.

column1: • Company profile listing the bidders’ address, branches, structure, resources, etc.
• Evidence of past satisfactory performance on the provision of similar supplies.

Tenders must be submitted in the bid box prepared for the purpose at SOS Children’s Village Ethiopia National office offices in Addis Ababa, located at Bole Atlas in front of Mado Hotel on April 24, 2025

column4: >Name of Project: Human Capital Operation Project

column5: >The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, Ministry of Finance has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Human Capital Operation Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds toward payments under the contract for the supply of Cooking Demonstration Kits for 575 health facilities of 23 Woredas for UNISE Implementation required items described below. The Ministry of Finance, the implementing entity of the project, now invites sealed quotation from eligible Bidders for supply of the following items

column9: >Competition will be conducted through national bid using a Request for quotations as specified in the World Bank's ""Procurement Regulations for IPF Bor-rowers"" September 2023 (""Procurement Regulations""), and is open to all eligible Bidders as defined in the Procurement Regulations.

column5: >Interested eligible Bidders may obtain further information from Ministry of Finance, Channel One Programs Coordinating Department and inspect the quotation document during office hour's 2:30 AM to 5:00 PM local time at the address given below. The bidding document in English may be purchased by interested eligible quotation provider upon the submission of a written application to the address below and upon payment of a non refundable fee of ETB 100. The method of payment will be in cash.

>Quotations must be delivered to the address below on or before 25 April 2025, Electronic quotation will not be permitted. Late Bids will be rejected. The quotation will be publicly opened in the presence of the Bidders' designated representatives and anyone who chooses to attend, at the address below on 25 April 2025. column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67f8b570a41708bfc5062ba1,Consultancy - Corporate Services,Ethiopian Shipping and Logistics would like to Invite Interested and Eligible Bidders for the Procurement of Asset Revaluation consultancy Service,The deadline for bid submission is the date and time of the ERP System.,"Apr 11, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >Ethiopian Shipping and Logistics would like to Invite Interested and Eligible Bidders for the Procurement of Asset Revaluation consultancy Service from bidders who can fulfill the following Terms and Conditions.

>Bidders who engage in the sector shall present renewed trade licenses, trade registration certificates, VAT registration, current tax clearance certificates, TIN certificates, and supplier list registration certificates.
>If bidders are foreigners, shall present business registration certification from the country of establishment.
>To access the tender document bidders shall register on our enterprise supplier list by using the link https://ehog.fa.em2.oraclecloud.com/fscmUI/faces/PrcPosRegisterSupplier?prcBuld=300000003585149
column3: or register in person at ESL Head Office 10th floor procurement department upon fulfilling trade license certificate and TIN (Taxpayer Registration Certificate) If bidders are foreigners, shall present business registration certification from the country of establishment starting from the date of this announcement.&nbsp

column2: >The bid shall be valid for 60 days after the system bid closing date.&nbsp

>Bidder shall submit bid security in person at the Head Office of the enterprise 10th floor procurement department and the amount of the bid security is 500,000 (Five Hundred Thousand) birr or the equivalent of USD or EURO. The type of acceptable bid security is: - unconditional bank guarantee or cash payment order (CPO). The bid security shall be valid for twenty-eight days (28) beyond the end of the validity period of the bid Proposal, Which shall remain valid for a period of 60 days + 28 days =88 days.
>Bidders shall give their price at line level in the system.
>ESL will hold a pre-bid conference with all bidders on the 10th date of the floating of the bid by the newspaper or by the next working day at ESL head office 10th-floor procurement department.

column3: ><strong>The deadline for bid submission is the date and time of the ERP System.&nbsp
Logistics Services Enterprise reserves the right to accept or reject the bids partially or totally.

column2: >Purchaser: Oromia Bureau of Agriculture, climate resilient wheat value chain development project, P-ET-AA-020

column3: Irrigation Schemes (SSIS) Works in Oromia Region

column2: >This Invitation for Bids follows the General Procurement Notice (GPN) for this project that appeared in UNDP online and on the African Development Bank Group's Internet Website dated 21st February 2024.

>1. The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia has received Financing from the African Development Bank in various currencies towards the cost of Climate Resilient Wheat Value Chain Development (CREW) Project, P-ET-AA-020. It is intended that part of the proceeds of this loan will be applied to eligible payments under the contract for the Rehabilitation and Expansion of Small-Scale Irrigation Schemes (SSIS) in Oromia Region.

>2. Oromia Bureau of Agriculture now invites sealed bids from eligible and qualified bidders [contractors] having GC/WWC-5 or above for the Rehabilitation and Expansion of Small-Scale Irrigation Schemes (SSIS) indicated in the table below:

>4. Bidding will be conducted through Open Competitive Bidding National procedures in accordance with the African Development Bank's Procurement Policy for Bank Group Funded Operations, dated October 2015 and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the Procurement Framework Interested eligible bidders may bid for any one of the above listed lots and may obtain further information and inspect the bidding documents at the office address given below in the morning from 8:30 AM to 12:30 PM and in the afternoon from 1:30 PM to 5:00 PM Monday to Friday.

>5. A complete set of bidding documents may be purchased by interested bidders upon the submission of a written application to the address below and upon payment of a non-refundable fee of ETB 2000.00 (two thousand Birr). The method of payment will be through bank transfer to CBE Acc. No 1000007342105

>6. All Bids must be valid for a period of 90 (ninety) days after Bid opening and must be accompanied by an original bid security of ETB as stated in the table above and in the form of an unconditional Bank Guarantee enforceable in the local registered banks, in the format provided in the Bidding Document,
>7. Bids must be delivered to the address below on or before 10:00 AM EAT on May 16, 2025. Electronic bidding will not be permitted. Late bids will be rejected.
>8. Bids shall be publicly opened at the address below, at 10:15 AM on the same date of closing in the presence of bidders or their designated representatives who choose to attend.

>9. Attention is drawn to the Procurement Framework requiring the Borrower to disclose information on the successful bidder's beneficial ownership, as part of the Contract Award Notice, using the Beneficial Ownership Disclosure Form as included in the bidding document.
>10. The addresses referred to above are:

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67f8c6c5e1e326599203c3c2,Construction and Real Estate,The Buldiglu Woreda finance office 3R-4CACE Project now invites sealed bids from qualified eligible bidders for the Drilling and Construction of 18- Shallow Wells,At 2:30 PM on or before 11th calendar days from the last advertisement date notice on the Ethiopian Herald,"Apr 11, 2025",Beneshangul Gumuz,Open,"

column2: >Project Type: Drilling and Construction of 18- Shallow Wells
>To: All contractors of category WC. Class five and above with renewed license valid for the 2017 E.C Year.

>1. The Buldiglu Worada finance office 3R-4CACE Project invites eligible bidder with water well drilling license level-5 and above which have renewed trade license, vat registration certificate, certificate of competence, trade license registration, supplier registration certificate of the 2017 for Drilling, and Construction 18 shallow wells.
>2. The source of fund is 3R PROJECT
column3: the payment for each lot will be requested separately by the bidder.

column2: >3. The Buldiglu Woreda finance office 3R-4CACE Project now invites sealed bids from qualified eligible bidders for the construction of the following numbers of items as indicated in each lots.

column3: >Lot 1. Construction of eleven (11) Shallow Well (SW) water supply scheme at Jenferere, Atseleho and Bulpili kebeles under Benishangul Gumuz Region in Assosa Zone in Buldiglu woreda.
>Lot 2. Construction of seven (7) Shallow Well (SW) water supply scheme at Faduni and Qedo kebeles under Benishangul Gumuz Region in Assosa Zone in Buldiglu woreda.

column2: >4.An interested bidder can purchase a complete set of bidding documents in English from the day that the advertisement appears in the Ethiopian Herald newspaper at Benishangul Gumuz region water, and energy resource development Bureau, Assosa for 11th calendar days from the last advertisement date of this notice on the Ethiopian herald during normal working hours upon payment of a non-refundable fee of Ethiopian Birr 2000.00 (Two Thousand Birr Only). The Method of payment will be in cash.

>5. The eligible bidders are expected to go through the bidding document and submit original and copies of their technical and financial proposals as well as bid security in separate wax sealed envelopes addressed to Benishangul Gumuz region buldiglu woreda finance office 3R-4CACE Project on or before 2:30 PM on or before 11th calendar days from the last advertisement date notice on the Ethiopian Herald and bids shall be opened at 3:00 PM at the Benishangul Gumuz Region water and Energy Buru,Assosa. Both technical and financial document will open and announced within 6 days at water and energy bureau Assosa. But after technical document evaluation is responsive the financial document will open at the same place (Benishangul Gumuz region water, and energy resource development Bureau meeting hall).

>6. Bidding will be conducted in accordance with the opening tender procedures contained in the Public Procurement Proclamation of the Government of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia and is open to all eligible bidders. Bids shall be valid for a period of sixty (60) days and Bid Security shall be Valid for 60 Days after Bid opening. All bids must be accompanied by a bid security, in an acceptable (CPO or bank guarantee) form amounting to 300,000 Birr (Three Hundred Thousand Birr Only) per lot and they shall be delivered to ""The Benishangul Gumuz Regional State Buldiglu woreda finance office 3R-4CACE Project at Benishangul Gumuz region water, and energy resource development Bureau ""on 2:30 PM on or before / 11th calendar days from the last advertisement date of this notice on the Ethiopian herald and the technical bids shall be opened at 3:00 PM at the same date &
column3: address in the presence of the bidders who wish to attend. Electronic bidding will not be permitted. Late bids will be rejected. If the 11th Calendar day is holyday, it will be on the next working day.

column2: >7. The award will be decided on a lot by lot basis. Bidders can bid for only in one lot (this is for a bidder who have only one drilling rig machine). But, bidders who have two and more drilling rig machines can bid both lots at the same time and the bid document to be submitted in separate for each lot. Bidders who have only one drilling rig machine and participate in both lot shall be rejected.

>8. Bidders shall be use Bill of quantities (BOQ) for shallow wells as stated on the bid document/tender bid which the procuring body offer BOQs with in respect to the lot number where they to be participated. If not it shall be rejected.

>9. Bidders should provide qualification requirements which include: (i) ownership (or existing lease agreement from official (Justice)) of a suitable drilling rig, (ii) completion of drilling and construction of at least one contracts of similar work in each of the last One year, (iii) annual turnover of 1.5 times the bid value in each of the last two years, (iv) liquid assets of at least 1/3 the contract value and (v) experienced drilling team. Additional details are provided in the Bidding Documents.
>10. The Benishangul Gumuz Regional State Buldiglu woreda finance office 3R-CACE Project reserve the right to reject all or part of the bid.
>Benishangul Gumuz Regional State Buldiglu woreda finance office

Bu'uuruma Kanaan odeeffannoowwan hoji(pirojektii) qonna boolla gabaabaa(Shallow Well) K/Fayyaa Dirree Jibboo waliin walqabatu gabatee gadii irratti kan ibsamee dha.

column2: >2.Gibira mootummaa kaffaluu isaa ragaa waajjira galiiwwanii irraa xaalayaadhan dhiyeefachuu qaba.
>3. Dorgomtootni barreeffama dhiyeessitoota(suppliers list) keessatti galmaa'uu isaanii waraqaa raga dhiyeessachuu qabu,
>4. Dorgomtootni galmaa'aa TIN fi VAT ta'uu isaanii ragaa dhiyeeffachuu kan danda'an

>5. Dorgomtootni guyyaa beeksifni kun qilleensa irra oole irraa kaasanii guyyoota hojii mootummaa hunda sa'aatii hojii mootummaatti sanada caalbaasichaa guutuu qarshii hin deebine 200(dhibba lama) kaffaluun Waajjira Maallaqaa Godina Sh/Kaabaa irraa bitachuu ni danda'u.

>6. Dookumantii galu irraa fi keessatti odeeffannoowwan guutamuu qaban qulqullinan fuula barbaachisu hundaa irratti guutamuu yoo baate, mallattoo, chaappaa fi haala gaafatameen saamsamee fi odeeffannoo barbaachisu kan hin qabne yoo yoo ta'e fudhatama hin argatu.

>7. Dorgomaan kamiyyuu maallaqa kabachiisa caalbaasi Waajjira Maallaqaa Godina Shawaa Kaabaa tiif jechuun hanga maallaqaa 1% gatii waliigala pirojektichaa bifa CPO ykn Wabummaa Baankii haalduree malee (Unconditional Bank Guarantee) qofaan dhiyeessuu qabu. Caalbaasiin ragga'ee kan turu guyyoota 90+18=118 guyyaa caalbaasin baname irraa kaasee ta'a.

>8. Dorgomtootni sanada yaada dorgommii caalbasii a) poostaa kabachiisa caalbaasii (CPO), sanada orjinaala teekinikaa fi sanada orjinaala gatii(faayinaansii) jechuun poostaa adda addaa sadiin poostaa tokko keessatti,b)Sanada koppii teekinikaa 1ffaa fi 2ffaa, sanada koppii faayinaansii 1ffaa fi 2ffaa jechuun poostawwan afuriin kophaa kophaatti samsuun poostaa tokko keessa galchuun dhumarratti poostawwan a fib poostaa hadhoo tokko keessa galchanii dhiyeessuu qabu.

>9.Kontiraaktarri kanaan dura hojii qulqullina hin qabne hojjatan, hoji addaan kutanii fi kan amma harkaa qaban yoo jiraate raawwiin fizikaala isaa 70% gadi yoo ta'e fi galmee gurraacha (black list) jala kan gale fudhatama hin qabu(kufaa ta'a)

>10. Caalbaasiin kun guyyaa beeksifni caalbaasii bahe irraa eegalee guyyoota hoji walitti aanan 15f qilleensa irra erga turee booda gaafa guyyaa 16ffaa bakka dorgomtootni ykn bakka buutotni isaanii argamanitti sa'aatii 8:00(local time) irratti Waajjira Maallaqaa Go/Sh/Kaabaatti saanduqa caalbaasitti gala.Guyyuma kana sa'aatii sa'aatii 8:30(local time) irratti kan banamu ta'a, guyyaan baniinasa caalbaasii guyyaa hojiitin ala yoo oole guyyaa hojii itti aanutti kan banamu ta'a.Dorgomaan sanada caalbaaşii yeroo dabarsee fide kufaa ta'a. Dorgomtootni ykn bakka buutotni dorgomtootaa yoo argamuu hin dandeenyes caalbasichi ni banama.

>11. Waajjirichi filannoo addaa yoo argate caalbaasicha gartokkeenis ta'ee guutumaan guututti haquuf mirga qaba.,Dorgomtootni ulaagaa guuttanii fi dorgomuuf fedhii qabdan teessoo gaditti kenname irraa odeeffannoo dabalataa argachuu ni dandeessu. Lakk. Bil. +251111350461/+251111353114 Waajjira Maallaqaa Go/Sh/Kaabaa Lakk Bil. +251111351007/+251912722713

column5:

INVITATION FOR TENDER
CONSTRUCTION OF KUDIYU KEBELE(LOT-1) AND TUMET JEBERONA KEBELE (LOT-2) WATER SUPPLY PROJECTS
April 2025

column2: >Pharo Foundation is a private foundation based in the United Kingdom and established in 2011. Committed to the development of Africa, the Foundation has been supporting projects in the Horn of Africa since its establishment. Our projects contribute towards increasing access to education, agriculture, health, and water
column3: and help improve people’s livelihoods. In Ethiopia, BGRS Program the Pharo Foundation is undergoing developmental works in education, agriculture, health and water projects. Under its water program, The Foundation has planned to increase access to adequate and safe water in different rural areas of Benishangul Gumuz Regional State.

column2: >To realize its plan, the Foundation BGRS Program floats this bid for the construction of two rural water supply projects (Kudiyu/Menge town, and Tumet Jeberona Kebele) in Benishangul Gumuz Regional State in Menge woreda in consultation with its budget, And invites eligible contractors with Water Works Construction License Grade 3 and above for the construction of the two rural water supply projects categorized as LOT-1 –Construction of Kudiyu/Menge town Water Supply Project and LOT-2-Construction of Tumet Jeberona kebele Water Supply Projects for this bid propose. The main components of the projects are:

column8: Construction of compound fence, and guard houses

Additionally, the supplying factory should be listed on the Conformity Assessment website(ecae.org.et). Please note that the failure to submit the required documents will result in cancellation of the bid.&nbsp
competent contractors can access and purchase the tender documents on the 2merkato.com website with&nbsp

column2: >A pre-bidding meeting, if necessary, will be arranged and communicated to all the bidders who bought the bid document before the bid closing date.

>Bidders are instructed to submit “One Original” and “one copy” of Technical and Financial: each document in different folders separately. Duly Labelled as ORIGIONAL AND COPY FOR BOTH PROPOSALS PROPERLY and shall be wax sealed in large outer mother envelope. And should be received by Pharo Foundation Country office, Addis Ababa, or, BGRS Program Office, Assosa town near Boro Shinasha Development Association Office not later than 2:00 PM 24th of Aprill 2025.
>All bids will be opened at Pharo Foundation BGRS Program office Assoa at 2:30 PM on 28th of April 2025 in the presence of the Contractors who wish to attend. Late bids shall be rejected.

>Bids shall be valid for a period of 60 calendar days after submission of Bids and must be accompanied by a Bid Security in the amount of 200,000 ETB (Two Hundred Thousand Birr) in the form of CPO or bank guarantee for each Lot.
>Evaluation is to be carried out in two stages, Qualification application first and financial document of qualified bidders next.&nbsp

>The Pharo foundation reserves the right to accept or reject any bid, and to annul the selection process and reject all tenders at any time, without thereby incurring any liability to the affected Companies.

>9.Kontiraaktarri kanaan dura hojii qulqullina hin qabne hojjatan, hojii addaan kutanii fi kan amma harkaa qaban yoo jiraate raawwiin fiizikaala isaa 70% gadi yoo ta'e fi gàlmee gurraacha (black list) jala kan gale fudhatama hin qabu(kufaa ta'a)

>10. Caalbaasiin kun guyyaa beeksifni caalbaasii bahe irraa eegalee guyyoota hoji walitti aanan 15f qilleensa irra erga turee booda gaafa guyyaa 16ff bakka dorgomtootni ykn bakka buutotni isaanii argamanitti sa'aatii 8:00(local time) irratti Waajjira Maallaqaa Go/Sh/Kaabaatti saanduqa caalbaasitti gala.Guyyuma kana sa'aatii sa'aatii 8:30(local time) irratti kan banamu ta'a, guyyaan baniinasa caalbaasii guyyaa hojiitiin ala yoo oole guyyaa hojii itti aanutti kan banamu ta'a. Dorgomaan sanada caalbaasii yeroo dabarsee fide kufaa ta'a. Dorgomtootni ykn bakka buutotni dorgomtootaa yoo argamuu hin dandeenyes caalbasichi ni banama.

>11. Waajjirichi filannoo addaa yoo argate caalbaasicha gartokkeenis ta'ee guutumaan guututti haquuf mirga qaba. Dorgomtootni ulaagaa guuttanii fi dorgomuuf fedhii qabdan teessoo gaditti kenname irraa odeeffannoo dabalataa argachuu ni dandeessu. Lakk. Bil. +251111350461/+251111353114 Waajjira Maallaqaa Go/Sh/Kaabaa Lakk Bil. +251111351007/+251912722713

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67f8db814818fca9fb081073,Uncategorized,"Mootummaan Naannoo Biyyoolessaa Oromiyaatti Waajjirri Bishaanii fi Inarjii Godina Shawaa | Kaabaa bara hojii 2017 keessatti ijaarsa pirojektii Bishaan Dhugaatii Aanaa Muloo keessatti Hojii Sivilii, Dhiyeessii Ujummoo, Dhiyeessii Wal-Qabsiftawwanii, Dhiyeessii Elektiroomakaanikaalaa | Fi Installation Caalbaasii Ifaa Baasee Dorgomsiisee hojjechisu Barbaada",Gaafa guyyaa 22ffaa Bakka dorgomtoonni ykn bakka bu'aan dorgomtootaa argamanitti Sa'a 8:00,"Apr 10, 2025",Oromia,Open,"

column2: >Mootummaan Naannoo Biyyoolessaa Oromiyaatti Waajjirri Bishaanii fi Inarjii Godina Shawaa | Kaabaa bara hojii 2017 keessatti ijaarsa pirojektii Bishaan Dhugaatii Aanaa Muloo keessatti Hojii Sivilii, Dhiyeessii Ujummoo, Dhiyeessii Wal-Qabsiftawwanii, Dhiyeessii Elektiroomakaanikaalaa Fi Installation Caalbaasii Ifaa Baasee Dorgomsiisee hojjechisu Barbaada.

>Bu'uuruma kanaan kontiraaktarri sadarkaa WWGC/WWC-5 fi isaa olii hayyama ijaarsaa 2017 harmomsisee fi hayyama isaa Ministeeraa ijaarsaa fi misooma Magaalaa, Ministeera Bishaanii fi AT Konistiraakshinii Oromiyaa irraa VAT fi TIN galmaa'an barreeffaman dhiyeeffachuu danda'an ulaagaa armaan gaditti ibsaman hordofuun caalbaasicha irratti akka hirmmattan affeeramtanii jirtu. Bu'uuruma kanaan Odeffanoowwaan pirojektii Bishaan Dhugaatii Muloo Qarsaa waliin wal- waqabatu haalaa gabatee armaan gadii irratti agarsiifamee ta'a
>1. Dorgomtooni ijaarsa sadarkaa WWGC/WWC-5 fi isaa olii beekkamtii qabanii fi hayyama haroome dhiyeeffachuu kan danda'u.
>2. Gibira mootummaa kan kaffale, kanfaluu isaaf ragaa waajjira galii itti kanfale irraa bifa | xalayaa barreeffaman dhiyeessuu qaba.
>3. Dorgomtootni tarreeffama dhiyeessitootaa (Supply List) keessatti galmaa'uu isaanii waraqaa ragaa dhiyeessu qaba.
>4. Dorgomtootni caalbaasichaa galmaa'aa lakk TIN fi VAT kan galmaa'ee fi kanaafis raga dhiyeessu kan danda'u.

>5. Dorgomtooni guyyaa beeksifni kun bahe irraa kaasee guyyoota hojii mootummaa hunda sa'aatii hojii mootummaa sanada caalbaasichaa guutuu qarshii hin deebine 1,000.00 (kuma tokko qofa) qofa kaffaluun waajjira Maallaqaa Go/Sh/Kaabaa irraa bitachuu ni dandeessu.
>6. Dokumeentiin galu irraa fi keessatti wantootni guuttamuu qaban seeraa fi qulqullina, fuula&nbsp
column3: hundaa irratti guuttamuu yoo baate, mallattoo, chaappaa fi saamsamuun odeeffannoo guutuu&nbsp
column4: yoo hin qabaanne fudhatama hin argatu.

column2: >7. Dorgomaan kamiyyuu maallaqaa caalbaasichaa kabachisuu danda'u Waajjira Maallaqaa Go/Sh/Kaabaatiif jechuun Qr.500,000.00 (Qarshii Kuma dhibba shan) bifa CPO ykn wabummaa baankii haal duree malee (Un conditional Bank Guarantee) qofaan ta'uu qaba. caalbaasiin ragga'ee kan turu guyyoota 90+28=118 guyyaa caalbaasiin baname irraa kaasee ta'a.

>8. Dorgomtootni sanada yaada dorgommii caalbaasii poostaa haadho tokko keessatii Kabachisa caalbaasii, teeknikaa fi Faayinaansii (Gatii) jechuun poostaa adda addaa sadii keessatti kophaa kophaa saamsuun dhiyeessuu qaba. kunis sanada yaada dorgommii teekinikaa fi Faayinaansii (gatii) original,waraabbii 1ffaa fi waraabbii 2ffaa kan of keessaatti haammatu ta'uu qaba.

>9. Kontiraaktarri kanaan dura hojii qulqullina hin qabne hojjete, hojii addaan kutanii fi kan amma harkaa qaban yoo jiraate fizikaalli hojichaa %75 gadi yoo ta'ee fi galmee gurraacha(black | list) jalatti kan galmaa'e fudhatama hin qabu (kufa ta'a).
>10. Caalbaasiin kun guyyaa beeksifni caalbaasiin bahe irraa eegalee guyyoota walitti aanaan 21'f&nbsp

column4: baninsa caalbaasii guyyaa hojii yoo ta'uu baate guyyaa hojii itti aanutti kan banamu ta'a. | Dorgomaan sanada caalbaasii yeroon hin dhiyeessin/yeroo dabarsee sanada caalbaasii yoo fide kufa ta'a. Dorgomtoonni ykn bakka bu'aan yoo argamuu baates baniinsi caalbaasii hin gufatu.

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67f8eb3f6a12401b19056323,Uncategorized,"Baankiin Sinqee W.A bu'ura Aangoo Labsii 97/1990, 216/1992 (akka Fooyya'eetti) fi 1147/2011tiin kennameefiin qabeenyota armaan gadütti ibsaman caalbaasiinngurguruu barbaada",Guyyaan adda,"Apr 10, 2025",Oromia,Open,"

column2: >Baankiin Sinqee W.A bu'ura Aangoo Labsii 97/1990, 216/1992 (akka Fooyya'eetti) fi 1147/2011tiin kennameefiin qabeenyota armaan gadütti ibsaman caalbaasiinn gurguruu barbaada

>1) Dorgomaan ykn bakka bu'aan seeraa dorgomaa gatii ka'uumsaa Caalbaasichaa 1/4ffaa Ajaja Baankii /C.P. O/ dhaan mirkanaa'e qofa qabsiisuun galmaa'uun dorgomuu ni danda'a. Dorgomaan Caalbaasiicha mo'ate guyyaa 15(kudha shan) keessatti gatii qabeenyicha ittiin mo'ate kaffalee xumuruu qaba. Kan hin xumurre yoo ta'e, qarshi qabsüse Baankichaaf galii ta'ee, Caalbaasichi kan haqamu ta'a. Dabalataan garaagarummaa gatii qabeenyichi Caalbaasichaaf irra deebiin ba'uun uumamuuf itti gaafatamaa ta'a.
>2) Dorgomaan caalbaasii irratti gatii ol'aanaa dhiyeesse caalbaasichaa mo'aachuu isaa qaama dhimmi ilaaluun erga mirkanaa'een booda xalayaa mo'aataa ta'uu isaa ibsuu kennamaaf.
>3) Dorgomtoota Caalbaasicha mo'atamaniif Ajaja Baankii /C.P.O'n qabsiisan guyyuma sana deebi'aaf.
>4) Caalbaasii irratti argamuu kan danda'u dorgomaa, liqeeffataa fi qabsiisaa qabeenya ykn bakka bu'aa seeraa isaanii qofa ta'a.
>5) Caalbaasichi kan adeemsifamu gabatee armaan olii keessatti ganda/Bulchiinsa magaalaa ibsameetti ta'a.

>6) Kaffaltii jijjirraa maqaa akkasumas kaffaltii liizii fi kanneen biroo bitataan bu'uura seeraatiin akka kaffaluuf murtaa'ee/dirqamu kanneen Taaksii waliin walqabatan bitataan/mo'ataan battala Caalbaasii mo'atee qabee kan kaffalu ta'a.

>7) Waldaan Daldalaa Waldicha bakka bu'ee Caalbaasicha irratti dorgomuu barbaade sanada aangoo qaamaa seerummaa qabaachuu isaa agarsiisu (Barreeffama Hundeeffamaa fi ykn Dambir ittiin Bulmaataa) fi aangoo bakka bu'insa seeraa qabatee dhiyaachuu qaba.

column3: 8) Baankichi karaa mijaawaa biroo yoo argatee, Caalbaasicha guutummaatti ykn gar-tokkeen haquuf mirgi isaa kan eegaamedha.

column2: >9) Narni qabeenya Caalbaasilf dhiyaate kana ilaaluu barbaadu, Dameelee liqeessaa beellama qabsiifachuun ilaaluu ni danda'a.

>10) Odeeffannoo dabalataaf: - Lakkoofsa bilbilaa Baankii Sinqee Kutaa Tajaajila Seeraa (+251-11557 1660), Distriktü Adaamaa (0913308235), Damee Bariisoo Dukkallee (0930606466) damee sokorruu (0911597477) ta'e irratti bilbiluun gaafachuun ni danda'a.

>Origin of the Goods and Related Services offered
>Bidder has to provide in the Bid Submission Sheet Form the Statement attesting the origin of the Goods and Related Services offered
>Bidder has to submit Manufacturer Authorization Letter in accordance with ITB Clause 5.6
>Bidder has to submit Descriptive technical literature in accordance with ITB Clause 17
>Completion of Technical Specification + Technical Offer+ Compliance Sheet Form

>Bidder has to complete its Technical Specification + Technical Offer+ Compliance Sheet Form in accordance with technical specification presented as per template in Section 6, Statement of Requirements and submit the following mandatory attachments
>Bidder has to submit Delivery and Completion Schedule presented as per template in Section 6, Statement of Requirements
>Bidder has to provide in the Bidder Certification of Compliance Form information about major relevant contracts successfully completed in the number and period specified in the BDS
>Submission of Certificates of satisfactory execution of contracts

>Bidder has to submit Certificates of satisfactory execution of contracts provided by contracting parties to the contracts successfully completed in the period and budget as specified in the BDS Clause 16.3
>Submission of Description of the organization of the warranty offered
>Bidder has to submit Description of the organization of the warranty offered in accordance with the conditions laid down in GCC Clause 23
