column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67f8cbb21133923d530dcdc2,Pharmaceuticals and Medical Supplies,"The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, hereby seeks expressions of interest (EOI) from qualified and experienced vendors for the Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA",25 April 2025,"Apr 11, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >This notice is placed by UNECA. The accuracy, reliability and completeness of the contents of furnished information is the responsibility of United Nations Economic Commission for Africa. You are therefore requested to direct all queries regarding this EOI to United Nations Economic Commission for Africa using the fax number or e-mail address provided below.

column1:
Title of the EOI: Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA
Date of this EOI: 10 April 2025
column4:
Closing Date for Receipt of EOI: 25 April 2025
EOI Number: EOIUNECA23570
Beneficiary Country/Territory: Ethiopia
Commodity/Service category: Health Services
Address EOI response by fax or e-mail to the Attention of: Ms. Etsegenet Teka/ Mr.Ali Assaad / Ms. Aster Zewde
Fax Number: N/A
E-mail Address: etsegenet.argaw@un.org

column2: >The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, hereby seeks expressions of interest (EOI) from qualified and experienced vendors for the Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA.

>Interested firms will be invited to the tender by an ""Invitation To Bid"" (ITB) at a later stage. This tender envisages a selection-capable bidding firm for the Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA.

>The United Nations Healthcare Center (UNHCC) looks to procure unavailable essential emergency medicines from pharmaceutical wholesalers and community pharmacies. The initiative aims in this procurement include prevent stockouts and ensure the continuous provision of high quality healthcare services to UNHCC beneficiaries.
>The continuous availability of essential emergency medicines by establishing contracts is: To minimize stockouts and ensure the steady availability of essential medicines.
>To enhance the responsiveness of the pharmacy unit to the needs of healthcare providers. To improve overall healthcare delivery and patient satisfaction among staff.
>Must be legally registered and licensed to operate as a pharmaceutical wholesaler, or community pharmacy.
>Must possess all necessary licenses, permits, and registrations required by the relevant national drug regulatory authority.

column3: Medical supplies are legally imported or manufactured, with all required documentation (e.g., import licenses, certificates of origin)&nbsp

column2: >The vendor must maintain high standards of quality control and assurance throughout their supply chain. Medicines must meet all relevant quality standards and specifications set by the local regulatory authority.
>Must have a proven track record of supplying high-quality, authentic, and safe medications. Capacity and Reliability:
>The vendor must demonstrate the capacity to consistently supply the required medicines in the quantities and timeframe specified by the UNHCC.
>Must demonstrate a reliable and consistent supply chain to ensure uninterrupted availability of medications.
>Must maintain adequate stock levels to meet the UNHCC's anticipated demand.
>The vendor should provide information on their stock levels and supply chain capabilities.

>Please note that the ECA is precluded from entering into contract with a firm that is not registered with ECA. Those interested in responding to this EOI but not currently registered as vendors with ECA, are encouraged to register before submission of the EOI in the United Nations Global Market Place (UNGM). Further details may be obtained by visiting https://www.ungm.org/Vendor/Registration . In order to be eligible for UNGM registration, please make sure to declare in writing the prerequisite for eligibility criteria itemized from A-F as included in EOI instructions attached.

column4: >Information on tendering for the UN Procurement System is available free of charge at the following address: https://www.ungm.org/Public/Notice
column5: Only the United Nations Global Marketplace (UNGM) has been authorised to collect a nominal fee from vendors that wish to receive automatically Procurement Notices or Requests for Expression Of Interest. Vendors interested in this Tender Alert Service are invited to subscribe on http://www.ungm.org

column2:
>
Vendors interested in participating in the planned solicitation process should submit the Vendor Response Form of this EOI electronically (through the link available on the next page) before the closing date set forth above.
>Companies can only participate in solicitations of the UN Secretariat after completing their registration (free of charge) at the United Nations Global Marketplace (www.ungm.org).

>As you express interest in the planned solicitation by submitting this response form, please verify that your company is registered under its full legal name on the United Nations Global Marketplace(www.ungm.org) and that your application has been submitted to the UN Secretariat.

>While companies can participate in solicitations after completion of registration at Basic Level, we strongly recommend all companies to register at least at Level 1 under the United Nations Secretariat prior to participating in any solicitations.

>Companies are reminded of the restrictions of employment of former UN personnel that were involved in the procurement process during their last three years of service as per ST/SGB/2006/15, including (a) employing those personnel for one year after separation of service and (b) allowing those personnel to communicate with, or appear before, active UN personnel for matters related to the procurement process for two years after separation of service. Violation of the provisions of ST/SGB/2006/15 may lead to suspension of the registration of the company as a UN vendor.
>PLEASE NOTE: You should express your interest to this EOI electronically at: https://www.ungm.org/Public/Notice/263994
>In case you have difficulties submitting your interest electronically, please contact etsegenet.argaw@un.org

column3: Registering as a Vendor with the United Nations

column2: >Vendors interested in fulfilling the requirement described above must be registered at the UN Global Marketplace (www.ungm.org) with the UN Secretariat in order to be eligible to participate in any solicitation. Information on the registration process can be found at https://www.un.org/Depts/ptd/vendors.
>In order to be eligible for UN registration, you must declare that:

column4: Your company (as well as any parent, subsidiary or affiliate companies) is not listed in, or associated with a company or individual listed in:
the IIC Oil for Food List website or, if listed on either, this has been disclosed to the United Nations Procurement Division in writing.
Your company (as well as any parent, subsidiary or affiliate companies) is not currently removed or suspended by the United Nations or any other UN organisation (including the World Bank)

Your company (as well as any parent, subsidiary of affiliate companies) is not under formal investigation, nor have been sanctioned within the preceding three (3) years, by any national authority of a United Nations Member State for engaging or having engaged in proscribed practices, including but not limited to: corruption, fraud, coercion, collusion, obstruction, or any other unethical practice

Your company has not declared bankruptcy, are not involved in bankruptcy or receivership proceedings, and there is no judgment or pending legal action against your company that could impair your company's operations in the foreseeable future

Your company does not employ, or anticipate employing, any person(s) who is, or has been a UN staff member within the last year, if said UN staff member has or had prior professional dealings with the Vendor in his/her capacity as UN staff member within the last three years of service with the UN (in accordance with UN post-employment restrictions published in ST/SGB/2006/15).

Your company undertakes not to engage in proscribed practices (including but not limited to: corruption, fraud, coercion, collusion, obstruction, or any other unethical practice), with the UN or any other party, and to conduct business in a manner that averts any financial, operational, reputational or other undue risk to the UN.

column2: >For Registered Vendors: Vendors already registered at the UN Global Marketplace with the UN Secretariat must ensure that the information and documentation (e.g. financial statements, address, contact name, etc.) provided in connection with their registration are up to date in UNGM. Please verify and ensure that your company is registered under its full legal name.
>For Vendors Interested in Registration: Vendors not yet registered should apply for registration on the United Nations Global Marketplace (http://www.ungm.org)
column3: information on the registration process can be found at https://www.un.org/Depts/ptd/vendors. Vendors must complete the registration process prior to the closing date of the REOI. Vendors who have not completed the UNGM registration process with the UN Secretariat before the closing date of the REOI are not considered eligible to participate in solicitations of the UN Secretariat. We strongly recommend all companies to register at least at Level 1 under the UN Secretariat prior to participating in any solicitations.

column2: >IMPORTANT NOTICE: Any false, incomplete or defective vendor registration may result in the rejection of the application or cancellation of an already existing registration.

>Vendors interested in participating in the planned solicitation process should forward their expression of interest (EOI) to United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) by the closing date set forth in this EOI. Due to the high volume of communications UNECA is not in a position to issue confirmation of receipt of EOIs.
>Please note that no further details of the planned solicitation can be made available to the vendors prior to issuance of the solicitation documents.&nbsp

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67f8cf736b16eadce90ac220,Vehicles and Automotive,Ethiopian Shipping and Logistics would like to invite interested and eligible bidders for Purchase of Heavy truck cover (Heavy duty water Proof PVC Coated Tarpaulin Canvas),The deadline for bid submission date and time is on ERP System,"Apr 11, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >Ethiopian Shipping and Logistics would like to invite interested and eligible bidders for Purchase of Heavy truck cover (Heavy duty water Proof PVC Coated Tarpaulin Canvas) upon fulfilling of the following terms and conditions.

>1. Bidders who engaged in the sector shall present renewed trade license, Trade registration certificate, current tax clearance certificates, TIN certificate, VAT certificate and supplier list registration certificate.

>2. To access the tender document Bidders shall register on our enterprise supplier list by using the Link:- https://ehog.fa.em2.oraclecloud.com/fscmUI/faces/PrcPosRegisterSupplier?prcBuld=300000003585149 or register in person at Head Office 10th floor at procurement department upon fulfilling trade license certificate and TIN (Taxpayer Registration Certificate) starting from the date of this announcement.
>3. The bid shall be valid for the period of 45 days after the system bid closing date.

>4. Bidder shall submit bid security in person at head office of the enterprise 10th floor procurement department and the amount of the bid security shall be 100,000 (One Hundred Thousand) birr. The type of acceptable bid security is: unconditional bank guarantee or cash payment order (CPO). The bid security shall be valid for twenty- eight days (28) beyond the end of the validity period of the bid proposal which shall be remained valid for a period of 45 +28=73 days.
>5. Bidder shall give their Unit price at Lines level form in the Oracle System without 15% VAT.

>6. If it is Necessary ESL has prepare a pre bid conference for all bidders after the floating of the bid by the newspaper and it will do on working day at ESL head office 10th floor procurement department.
>7. The deadline for bid submission date and time is on ERP System.

column3: Logistics Services Enterprise reserves the right to accept or reject the bids partially or totally.

column2: >ዩኒቨርሲቲው የተሻለ አማራጭ ካገኘ ጨረታውን በከፊልም ሆነ በሙሉ የመሰረዝ መብቱ የተጠበቀ ነው።

>የጨረታ ማስከበሪያ ቢድ ቦንድ/CPO፤ ጥቃቅን አነስተኛ ለሆኑ ከሚመለከተው መስሪያ ቤት የብር መጠን የተጠቀሰበት የዋስትና ደብዳቤ ላይ የጨረታው ሎት ተጠቅሶ ጨረታው ጊዜ ከመጠናቀቁ አንድ ቀን አስቀድመው አዲስ አበባ ኮሪያ ዘማቾች ፓርክ ፊት ለፊት በሚገኘው በዩኒቨርሲቲው የማስተባበሪያ ጽ/ቤት ወይም መደወላቡ ዩኒቨርሲቲ ማቅረብ ይኖርበታል።
>ተወዳዳሪ ድርጅት ለእንዳንዳንዱ የእቃ ናሙና (Item Sample) ማቅረብ ይኖርበታል።
>አሸናፊው ድርጅት ዕቃውን መደወላቡ ዩኒቨርሲቲ ድረስ ማቅረብ ግዴታ አለበት።

column2: >ተጫራቾች አሸናፊ የሚኆኑባቸውን ዓያንዳንዱን እቃ ሆለታ በሚገኘው የእንሰሳት ልማት ማእከል እቃ ግምጃ ቤት ድረስ በራሱ ትራንስፖርት በመውሰድ ያቀረበውን እቃ ጥራቱ እና ትክክለኛነቱ በባለሙ የማረጋገጫ ሪፖርት ሲቀርብ ክፍያ የሚከፈል ይሆናል።
>ማንኛውም ተጫራች ጨረታው ከመከፈቱ በፊት ሲ.ፒ .ኦ በአካል ማቅረብ ይኖርባቸዋል።
>ማንኛውን ተጫራች በጨረታ መክፈቻ ዕለት የጨረታ መክፍቻ ቁልፍ መላክ ይኖርበታል።ነገር ግን መክፈቻ ቁልፍ ሳይልኩ ቀርተው ጨረታው ሳይከፈት ቢቀር መ/ቤቱ ሃላፊነቱን አይውስድም።
>ማሳሰቢያ፡-መ/ቤቱ የተሻለ አማራጭ ካገኘ ጨረታውን ሙሉ በሙሉ/በከፊል የመሰረዝ መብቱ ይጠበቃል።

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fa0ccee32dd0a9e80d9d11,Vehicles and Automotive,Ethiopian Shipping and Logistics would like to invite interested and eligible bidders for Purchase of Heavy truck cover (Heavy duty water Proof PVC Coated Tarpaulin Canvas),The deadline for bid submission date and time is on ERP System,"Apr 12, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >Ethiopian Shipping and Logistics would like to invite interested and eligible bidders for Purchase of Heavy truck cover (Heavy duty water Proof PVC Coated Tarpaulin Canvas) upon fulfilling of the following terms and conditions.

>1. Bidders who engaged in the sector shall present renewed trade license, Trade registration certificate, current tax clearance certificates, TIN certificate, VAT certificate and supplier list registration certificate.

>2. To access the tender document Bidders shall register on our enterprise supplier list by using the Link:- https://ehog.fa.em2.oraclecloud.com/fscmUI/faces/PrcPosRegisterSupplier?prcBuld=300000003585149 or register in person at Head Office 10th floor at procurement department upon fulfilling trade license certificate and TIN (Taxpayer Registration Certificate) starting from the date of this announcement.
>3. The bid shall be valid for the period of 45 days after the system bid closing date.

>4. Bidder shall submit bid security in person at head office of the enterprise 10th floor procurement department and the amount of the bid security shall be 100,000 (One Hundred Thousand) birr. The type of acceptable bid security is: unconditional bank guarantee or cash payment order (CPO). The bid security shall be valid for twenty- eight days (28) beyond the end of the validity period of the bid proposal which shall be remained valid for a period of 45 +28=73 days.
>5. Bidder shall give their Unit price at Lines level form in the Oracle System without 15% VAT.

>6. If it is Necessary ESL has prepare a pre bid conference for all bidders after the floating of the bid by the newspaper and it will do on working day at ESL head office 10th floor procurement department.
>7. The deadline for bid submission date and time is on ERP System.

column3: Logistics Services Enterprise reserves the right to accept or reject the bids partially or totally.

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fa106c1f0e1af1ec06e612,IT and Infrastructure,"The United Nation Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) is seeking Expression of Interest (EOI) to procure a WhatsUP Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool that provides complete visibility into the status and performance of applications, network devices and servers in the cloud or on-premises",21April 2025.,"Apr 12, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >This notice is placed on behalf of UNECA. You are therefore requested to direct all your queries to United Nations Economic Commission for Africa using the e-mail address provided below.
>Title of the EOI: Request for Procurement of WhatsUp Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool
>Closing Date for Receipt of EOI: 21 April 2025
>Address EOI response by fax for the Attention of: Mrs. Welela Berihu / Mr. Ali Assaad

>The United Nation Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) is seeking Expression of Interest (EOI) to procure a WhatsUP Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool that provides complete visibility into the status and performance of applications, network devices and servers in the cloud or on-premises.

>The required specification for this tool is functionality and simplicity, giving us full insight of our infrastructure operation while consuming minimum resources. WhatsUp Gold achieves this with its offering of comprehensive features yet straight forward UI for ease of use.
>The bidding firm must be an authorized reseller with after sales support&nbsp
>The tool must offer perpetual license options for 500 new devices.

>Please note that the UNECA is precluded from entering into contract with a firm that is not fully registered with UNGM. Those interested in responding to this invitation but not currently fully registered as vendors with UNGM, are encouraged to register before submission of the bid. Further details may be obtained by visiting https://www.ungm.org/Vendor/Registration. In order to be eligible for UN Registration, please make sure to declare in writing the Prerequisite for Eligibility criteria itemized from A-F as contained in EOI instruction attached. UNECA reserves the right to verify statements by the EOI respondent and not to invite all those companies who had expressed interest. Only eligible firms that are successful at this pre- qualification stage will be invited to participate in the later stage. Those interested should write to the above-mentioned email address to submit their ""Expression of Interest"" by the deadline of 21April 2025.
>Interested vendors should submit a fully completed Vendor Response Form to the link provided. It is to be noted that the successful bidder will be required to Register in UNGM before&nbsp
>Vendors interested in participating in the planned solicitation process should complete the Vendor Response Form https://www.ungm.org/Public/Notice/264118

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fa153e8621b1616306af71,Renewable Energy,"Save the Environment Ethiopia invites all eligible bidders for the Procurement and installation of Solar Water pump in Melkadida, Somali Region",The bid closing date will be on the 10th day from the date of this advertisement.,"Apr 12, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"
column2: >Re-advertizement for an Open Bid for the Procurmnet and installation of Solar Water pump in Melkadida, Somali Region

>Save the Environment Ethiopia is a non-profit, non-religious and non-political local NGO, operating in the Somali Regional State of Ethiopia mainly of Fafen, Liban and Dolo zones. It is registered at Federal Charities and Societies Agency as an Ethiopian Residents Charity in accordance with the charities and societies proclamation No .621/2009, bearing in number 3031 has been issued on May 6, 2019. With this advertisement for a bid SEE is inviting eligible companies for supply and installation of Solar water pump for an irrigation project in Melkadida refugee camps.
>Project Protect-24 “Control and utilization of P.juliflora integrated with livelihood improvement and environmental protection in Liban zone (Dollo-ado &amp
column3: Bokolmayo districts)’ funded by Spanish Cooperation

column2: >1. Save the environment Ethiopia invites all eligible bidders for the supply, transport to Dolo ado and Bokolomyo districts, and installation of solar water pump with the specifications listed in the table below
>2. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information about the bid document and bid application form at save the Environment Ethiopia Addis Ababa, Jigjiga, or Melkadida using address below.

>3. All bidders shall submit bid document with a copy in wax- sealed envelopes to Save the Environment Ethiopia office Jigjiga, Addis Ababa or Melkadida office. The bid closing date will be on the 10th day from the date of this advertisement.

>4. The bid will be opened one day after the closing date, officially at the Save the Environment Ethiopia office in the presence of bidders or legal representative and we will notify the time though your emails.
>5. Save the Environment Ethiopia reserves the right to accept or reject any or all the bids.
>6. A bidder should have a renewed 2017EC trade license, have TIN number and register with the Vat and have legal capacity to enter a contract.
>7. A successful bidder will enter into a contract agreement with SEE to supply and install the materials when he/she receives an authorized purchase requisition.

>8. If any dispute from nonperformance noncompliance with the term and condition set forth in the dual agreement between the supplier and save the environment, parties shall submit their dispute to the Somali Regional state higher court whose decision will be final
>9. Please refer to the specification of the solar items, in the bid document please specify the country of production
>10. Indicate delivery date of the whole sets, installation date and project completion dates&nbsp
column3: Save the Environment Ethiopia, Addis Ababa office, Gurd Shola area, Daminarof building next to Century Mall, 5th Floor, office #503 or Jigjiga Ethiopia P.O.Box 620, Mobile: 0911012645, 0960089575 , Jijiga office 0912120750, &nbsp

column2: >Protect 24-project 11 Kilowatt Solar water pumping BOQ for 25 hectare-farm (4 sets, each 25 ha.)&nbsp

column17: > appropriate fuses or circuit breakers for 4 arrays (single array short circuit current = 13.5A), total DC voltage up to 700V.

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fa16cf489917260000ee00,Construction and Real Estate,"The Ministry of Water and Energy now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the procurement of Drilling, Construction and pumping test of three Deep Production wells for kumbi wereda Multi Village Water supply project in East Hararge Zone, (at Jiddo Well field)","May 15, 2025 at 10:00 AM","Apr 12, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >Country: The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia.
>Name of Project: Climate Resilient -Water Supply and Sanitation Project
>Contract Title: Procurement of Drilling, Construction and pumping test of three Deep Production wells for kumbi wereda Multi Village Water supply project in East Hararge Zone, (at Jiddo Well field)

>1. The Government of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the implantation or Water supply, sanitation and Hygiene projects and intends to apply part of the proceeds toward payments under the contract for Procurement of Procurement of Drilling, Construction and pumping test of Three Deep Production wells for kumbi wereda Multi Village Water supply project in East Hararge Zone, (at Jiddo Well field). ""For this contract, the Borrower shall process the payments using the Direct Payment disbursement method, as defined in the World Bank's Disbursement Guidelines for Investment Project Financing, except for those payments, which the contract provides to be made through letter of credit.
>2. The Ministry of Water and Energy now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the procurement of works, as stated in the outlined below.

column3: >Drilling, Construction and pumping test of three deep production wells at Kumbi wereda MVWSP
>At kumbi Wereda in East Hararge Zone, (at Jiddo Well field)

column2: >In addition to the requirements listed below, the bidders are encouraged to read and respond to the exhaustive list of post qualification requirements specified in the RFB section III. Financial Situation and Performance

column3: >i.The Bidder shall demonstrate that it has access to, or has available, liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means (independent of any contractual advance payment) sufficient to meet the construction cash flow requirements estimated as ETB 23 Million for the subject contract(s) net of the Bidder is other commitments.

>ii. The Bidders shall also demonstrate, to the satisfaction of the Employer, that it has adequate sources of finance to meet the cash flow requirements on works currently in progress and for future contract commitments.

>iii. The audited balance sheets or, if not required by the laws of the Bidder's country, other financial statements acceptable to the Employer, for the last Five years (2020 to 2024) shall be submitted and must demonstrate the current soundness of the Bidder's financial position and indicate its prospective long-term profitability.

column2: >Peak annual construction turnover of 75 million or above calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress and/or completed within the last Five years (2020 to 2024).
>Experience under construction contracts in the role of prime contractor, JV member, subcontractor, or management contractor for at least the last 5 years, starting January 2020 G.C.

>The Bidder has successfully participated as contractor or subcontractor in at least 1(one) contract within the last 5(five) years, with a value of 95 Million ETB and above with a similar size, nature, complexity, and scope of drilling works that have been successfully and substantially completed. The contract performed should be supported by the name and addresses of the clients.

>For contractors who executed the drilling works in separate two contracts, 47,500,000.00 ETB or more for each drilling work contracts are required. For ongoing project, at least 80% of the work is completed successful. The similarity is related to drilling contract of water supply project.

>4. Bidding will be conducted through National competitive procurement using a Request for Bids (RFB) as specified in the World Bank's ""Procurement Regulations for IPF Borrowers"" (July 2016, revised November, 2017, July 2018 and November 2020, and September 2023), (""Procurement Regulations""), which can be found at the following website: worldbank.org. This process incorporates the national procurement directives as required in making consistent with World Bank requirements.
>The bid is open to all eligible Bidders as defined in the Procurement Regulations.

>5. Interested eligible bidders can obtain further information from the Ministry of Water and Energy by contacting Mr. Tesfaye Lulie, the PMU Coordinator, at tesfayelulie.ownp@gmail.com . A scanned copy of the bidding document, prepared in English, is available for free download at https://www.mowe.gov.et/en/tenders . Local bidders must register in person during office hours (8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. and 1:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m.), while foreign bidders should email their address to the PMU Coordinator to complete their registration.

>6. Bids must be delivered to the address below on or before May 15, 2025 at 10:00 AM. Electronic Bidding will not be permitted. Late Bids will be rejected. The outer Bid envelopes marked ""Original Bid"", and the inner envelopes marked ""Technical proposal and financial proposal"" will be publicly opened in the presence of the Bidders' designated representatives and anyone who chooses to attend, at the address below on May 15, 2025 at 10:30 AM.

>7. All bids must be accompanied by a bid security of ETB 500,000.00(Five Hundred Thousand Birr) in the form of an unconditional bank guarantee or CPO in the name of the Ministry of Water and Eneray. The bid security shall be valid for twenty-eight days (28) beyond the end of the validity period of the bid. The client reserves the right to accept or reject the bid partially or totally.

>8. Attention is drawn to the Procurement Regulations requiring the Borrower to disclose information on the successful bidder's beneficial ownership, as part of the Contract Award Notice, using the Beneficial Ownership Disclosure Form as included in the bidding document.
>9. The address(es) referred to above is (are):
>Street address: Haile Gebresilasie Avenue, around Hayahulet.

column3: Energy, First Floor, and Room number 112.

column2: >JSI is a US-based public health non-profit organization that provides high-quality technical and managerial assistance programs throughout the world. It is dedicated to improving people's lives around the world through greater health, education, and socioeconomic equity for individuals and communities. For over 45 years, JSI has been at the forefront of global public health. With its global team of over 3.500 dedicated staff, JSI supports govemments. health professionals, civil society, and community leaders in more than 40 countries 351 provides technical expertise for complex, locally led public health initiatives ranging from pandemic preparedness health information systems, and supply chains to workforce development and digital education.

>The Ethiopia Data Use Partnership (DUP) Work Stream 1. Funded by the Gates Foundation (BF), is a collaborative project between the JSI Research and Training Institute (JSI) and the Ethiopian Ministry of Health (MOH) aimed at advancing the country's healthcare through the Information Revolution (IR) agenda. This vision emphasizes fostering an information culture, digitizing and expanding priority Health Information System (HIS), and enhancing HIS governance.

>This request for quotation is to invite locally registered companies for procurement of 24 (Twenty-Four tablets) as per the given specification which will be used for project engagement In implementation of Alliance for Gender Awareness and Resourcefulness (AGAR). Interested Potential Suppliers having a valid trade license and specialized in the field can send an e-mail to Elizabeth Yoseph, via elizabeth_yoseph@et.jsi.com requesting the bid document prepared for the purpose fee of change before April 15, 2025, 5:00 pm Local time/ Addis- Ababa,
>Bidders are required to submit the following documents enclosed with the quotation:

column5: >The Ethiopian Agricultural Transformation Institute, Amhara Agricultural Transformation Centre (AATC) is inviting eligible bidders for the Procurement of Different Vegetable Seed
>Bidders must present renewed trade License, Taxpayer Registration Certificate and VAT registration certificate when submitting their offer.

>1. Beginning from the first announcement date on the newspaper, interested bidders can obtain the bidding document upon a payment of non- refundable fee of ETB 200.00 /Two Hundred from Amhara Agricultural Transformation Centre (AATC) at Bahir Dar, Aregawin Building 2nd Floor or from Ethiopian Agricultural Transformation Institute Addis Ababa, Bole: off Mescal Flower Road, in front of Commercial Graduates' Association at 3rd floor.

>2. Bids must be accompanied by bid security in the form of unconditional bank guarantee or CPO and the bid security shall remain valid for the days indicated in the Bid doc. The amount of the bid security is 30,000 (Thirty Thousand Birr only).

>3. The bid documents should be submitted in one original and one copy. ""Original Technical Document"" and ""Copy of Technical Document"" respectively, and the two envelopes shall then be sealed in an outer envelope marked: ""Technical Document"". Similarly, the original and copies of the financial documents shall be sealed in separate envelopes and marked ""Original Financial Document"" and ""Copy of Financial Document"" respectively, and the two envelopes shall then be sealed in an outer envelope marked: ""Financial Document"". Then the technical and financial documents shall then be sealed in mother envelop marked with the name of the Bidder and project. All envelopes shall then be scaled. All bids shall be delivered to Ethiopian Agricultural Transformation Institute, Amhara Agricultural Transformation Centre before the bid clothing date and time.

>4. Bid closing date shall be April 28, 2025, G.C at 2:00 PM in the afternoon and will be opened in the presence of interested bidders or their legal representatives at the office of Amhara Agricultural Transformation Centre Kebele 14 Aregawiyan Building 2nd floor Conference Room on the same date at 2:30 PM in the afternoon. If the bid opening date is a holiday, closing and opening of the bid will be the next working day at the same time and the same venue.
>5. Ethiopian Agricultural Transformation Institute, Amhara Agricultural Transformation center (ATI-AATC) reserves the right to accept or reject any or all bid, and to annul the ding process.

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fa30f8cc12ffbdb300e360,Consultancy - Uncategorized,"The Hailemariam & Roman Foundation has received a financing from Agence Française de Dévelopement (""AFD""), intends to procure consultancy service to undertake Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS)",No later than April 29/2025,"Apr 12, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column5: >The Preservation of Maze National Park and its Watershed in Ethiopia
>Expressions of Interest to undertake Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS)

column6: Roman Foundation has received a financing from Agence Française de Dévelopement (""AFD""), and intends to use part of the funds thereof for payments under the following project The Preservation of Maze National Park and its Watershed in Ethiopia.

column5: >The consulting firm's services shall consist of conducting an Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS) in the context of the Maze National Park conservation and community livelihoods project, titled ""The Preservation of Maze National Park and its Watershed in Ethiopia"". This initiative, fully funded by the Agence Française de Développement (AFD). builds on HRF's longstanding commitment to sustainable conservation and community development. Maze National Park, one of the smaller regional parks in South Ethiopia, faces increasing threats from climatic and anthropogenic impacts. The overall long-term goal of the project is to ensure the long-term integrity of Maze National Park for the benefit of Nature and communities. This consultancy assignment is part of a larger five-year donor-funded project (2024-2028), fully supported by the Agence Française de Développement (AFD) and implemented by HRF.

>The AAS aims to assess the current livelihood strategies and activities of local communities surrounding the park, evaluate their impact on its biodiversity, and suggest alternative, sustainable livelihood options that balance the community's economic needs with the park's conservation goals. Specifically, the study will focus on assessing the socio-economic and demographic profiles of the communities. documenting existing agricultural and off-farm activities, and recommending agriculture-related livelihood strategies that will reduce pressure on the park's resources that can be operationalize by HRF and the activities proposed are in line with the already agreed Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF) and the Environmental and Social Management Plan (ESMP) of Maze Project.

>The scope of the services includes collecting and analyzing quantitative and qualitative data from communities within five woredas (Zala, Daramalo, Kucha. Kucha Alpha, and Kamba) and 17 park-adjacent kebeles. The applicant is expected to design data collection tools and conduct surveys, key informant interviews, focus group discussions, and field observations. Furthermore, the applicant will develop a comprehensive report based on the findings, including recommendations for sustainable livelihoods and strategies for mitigating the impact of agricultural activities on the park. The services will also involve collaborating with local government offices. park staff, and the HRF Program team to validate findings and ensure stakeholder engagement throughout the study process. The expected duration of the assignment is approximately 2-3 months, during which the applicant is required to deliver key reports, including an inception report, draft and final AAS report with a brief policy brief and clean datasets for future monitoring and evaluation. The contract size for this study involves multiple expert months, with the applicant responsible for all aspects of fieldwork, data analysis, and report preparation. Applicants with advanced degrees in agronomy, environmental economics, or related fields and experience in conducting similar socio-economic studies in rural settings are encouraged to apply. Familiarity with the local language and culture context is an added advantage]².
Roman Foundation hereby invites Applicants to show their interest in delivering the Services described above.

column4: >This Request for Expressions of Interest is open to:

column5: >Joint Venture between NGO(s) and consulting firm(s)

>Eligibility criteria to AFD financing are specified in sub-clause 1.3 of the ""Procurement Guidelines for AFD-Financed Contracts in Foreign Countries"", available online on AFD's website: http://www.afd.fr.

>The Applicant shall submit only one application, either in its own name or as a member of a Joint Venture (JV). If an Applicant (including any JV member) submits or participates in more than one application, those applications shall be all rejected. However, the same Subconsultant may participate in several applications.
>1.If the project is specified. Otherwise, the identified specific Services shall be named.

>2 The information provided should allow the interested Applicants to decide whether they will submit an expression of interest or not. In particular, an estimate of the contract size should be indicated (number of experts-months or budget available, but not both).

column4: >If the Applicant is a JV, the expression of interest shall include:
>a copy of the JV Agreement entered into by all members, or

column5: >a letter of intent to execute a JV Agreement, signed by all members together with a copy of the Agreement proposal.
>In the absence of this document, the other members will be considered as Subconsultants.
>Experiences and qualifications of Subconsultants are not taken into account in the evaluation of the applications.

>Interested Applicants must provide information evidencing that they are qualified and experienced to perform those Services. For that purpose, documented evidence of recent and similar services shall be submitted.

column4: >Determination of the similarity of the experiences will be based on:
>The contracts size: Sound experience leading surveys covering wide geographic areas and sampling more than 400 households.
>The nature of the Services: Agrarian Analysis, Socio-economic studies, and Livelihood studies:

column5: >The technical area and expertise: The consulting firm must have team experts with an advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in agronomy, environmental economics, development economics, agri-business and value chain, development studies, or other relevant fields and adequate and dependable work experience conducting Agrarian Analysis, preferably done on rural/agricultural-related livelihood diversification. working with the community around park/ protected areas and conducting surveys, FGD and KII with the community, and experience in working with similar projects with different local and international NGOs are additions. Working in national parks or protected areas in rural settings (e.g. quantitative and qualitative field assessments, participatory rural appraisals, livelihoods diversification). The consulting firm must have experts who have strong communication and presentation skills in multiple sets of quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis using different statistical packages (Stata and SPSS), and a proven command of written and spoken English: familiarity with the project area language is an added advantage.
>The location: Experience working in national parks, or protected areas in Ethiopia or a comparable context and local communities living near national parks and protected areas.
>At least 5 years of relevant working experience in Ethiopia and information collection in rural areas, particularly in national parks and protected areas.
>Expertise in data analysis tools and methodologies
>An application that does not meet any of these requirements will be rejected.]

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fcb31c688817cf64040ed2,IT and Infrastructure,"The United Nation Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) is seeking Expression of Interest (EOI) to procure a WhatsUP Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool that provides complete visibility into the status and performance of applications, network devices and servers in the cloud or on-premises",21 April 2025.,"Apr 13, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >This notice is placed on behalf of UNECA. You are therefore requested to direct all your queries to United Nations Economic Commission for Africa using the e-mail address provided below.
>Title of the EOI: Request for Procurement of WhatsUp Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool
>Closing Date for Receipt of EOI: 21 April 2025
>Address EOI response by fax for the Attention of: Mrs. Welela Berihu / Mr. Ali Assaad

>The United Nation Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) is seeking Expression of Interest (EOI) to procure a WhatsUP Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool that provides complete visibility into the status and performance of applications, network devices and servers in the cloud or on-premises.

>The required specification for this tool is functionality and simplicity, giving us full insight of our infrastructure operation while consuming minimum resources. WhatsUp Gold achieves this with its offering of comprehensive features yet straight forward UI for ease of use.
>The bidding firm must be an authorized reseller with after sales support&nbsp
>The tool must offer perpetual license options for 500 new devices.

>Please note that the UNECA is precluded from entering into contract with a firm that is not fully registered with UNGM. Those interested in responding to this invitation but not currently fully registered as vendors with UNGM, are encouraged to register before submission of the bid. Further details may be obtained by visiting https://www.ungm.org/Vendor/Registration. In order to be eligible for UN Registration, please make sure to declare in writing the Prerequisite for Eligibility criteria itemized from A-F as contained in EOI instruction attached. UNECA reserves the right to verify statements by the EOI respondent and not to invite all those companies who had expressed interest. Only eligible firms that are successful at this pre- qualification stage will be invited to participate in the later stage. Those interested should write to the above-mentioned email address to submit their ""Expression of Interest"" by the deadline of 21April 2025.
>Interested vendors should submit a fully completed Vendor Response Form to the link provided. It is to be noted that the successful bidder will be required to Register in UNGM before&nbsp
>Vendors interested in participating in the planned solicitation process should complete the Vendor Response Form https://www.ungm.org/Public/Notice/264118

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fcc0e582f8fe64b10b5db1,Consultancy - Agriculture and Agro-Processing,"The Ministry of Agriculture (MoA) now invites eligible consulting firms (""Consultants"") for Assessment of Livelihood Support and Pesticide inventory Storage Standard (Post Distribution Assessment of Agricultural Inputs and Assessment of Pesticides Store Standards in Ethiopia)","At 10:00 AM on April 30, 2025.","Apr 13, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >Name of Project: Ethiopian Emergency Locust Response Project (EELRP)

>Assignment Title: Assessment of Livelihood Support and Pesticide inventory Storage Standard (Post Distribution Assessment of Agricultural Inputs and Assessment of Pesticides Store Standards in Ethiopia)

>The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia has received financing from International Development Association (IDA) and other Development Partners toward the cost of: Ethiopian Emergency Locust Response Project (EELRP Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services,

>The consulting services (""the Services"") includes the services of carrying out Assessment of Livelihood Support and Pesticide inventory Storage Standard (Post Distribution Assessment of Agricultural Inputs and Assessment of Pesticides Store Standards in Ethiopia).
><strong>The objectives of the Assessment are as follows

>The general objective of this assignment is to conduct post-harvest assessment of agriculture input distribution interventions of the project under the livelihood component and produce report with findings on the distribution process, results, lesson learned, success stories and recommendations to inform the on-going project implementation of the livelihood component of the project with specific objection
>Assess the performance of the project input distribution intervention in achieving its objectives under the livelihood component
>Assess the input variety, quantity, quality and timeline of inputs distributed meets beneficiaries' needs
>Assess the intended recipients are receiving support as per the project design,

>Assess the process of providing livelihood interventions to the affected households and whether the process of selecting the affected households and determining the level of livelihood support they require was open and transparent with the involvement of local communities
>Assessing how much the assistance effectively addresses the extent of the damage caused by locust infestations
>Assess whether accountability mechanisms were in place at the community, woreda and project levels.
>Assesses the documentation of input distribution list, and other livelihood related documentation at woreda and regional level across the project
>Assess how effectively the project has engaged with key stakeholders and beneficiaries
>Examine the project's results and its contributions to livelihood rehabilitation
>Provide lessons learned, success stories, and actionable recommendations to inform the project implementation.

>The Food Security Coordination Office (FSCO) of the Ministry of Agriculture (MoA) now invites eligible consulting firms (""Consultants"") to indicate their interest in providing the services. Interested consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services (brochures, description of similar assignments, experience in similar conditions, availability of appropriate skills among staff, etc.).

>Core business and years in business, relevant experience, and technical and managerial capability of the firm. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to Section III, paragraphs, 3.14, 3.16, and 3.17 of the World Bank's ""Procurement Regulations for IPF Borrowers"" July 2016 revised November 2017, July 2018 and Nov. 2020 (""Procurement Regulations""), setting forth the World Bank's policy on conflict of interest.

>Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy to enhance their qualifications, and should indicate clearly whether the association is in the form of a joint venture or a sub-consultancy.

>In the case of a joint venture, all the partners in the joint venture shall be jointly and severally liable for the entire contract, if selected. A Consultant will be selected in accordance with the Quality and Cost Based Selection Method (QCBS) set out in the Procurement Regulations.

>Further information and the Terms of Reference for the consultancy assignment can be obtained at the address below during office hours, 9:00am to 12:00 noon and 2:00pm to 5:00 pm. From April 11-April 30, 2025
>Expressions of interest must be delivered in a written form to the address below (in person, or by mail, or by fax, or by e-mail) on or before 10:00 AM on April 30, 2025.
>CMC Road, Behind Ministry of trade and regional

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fcc130fdd55ef66e0fed21,Consultancy - Water and Sanitation,Ministry of Water and Energy invite to eligible bidders for Consultant Service for Environmental and Social impact assessment (ESIA) Study for flood protection infrastructure civil works of (Awash. Omo. and Rift Valley Lakes).,"Before 24, 2025 4:00 pm","Apr 13, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"
column5: >REQUEST FOR EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST (CONSULTING SERVICES - FIRMS SELECTION)

column4: >Ethiopia Flood Management Project (E-FMP) Grant No. E124-Et

column5: >ASSIGNMENT TITLE: Consultant Service for Environmental and Social impact assessment (ESIA) Study for flood protection infrastructure civil works of (Awash. Omo. and Rift Valley Lakes).

>The Government of Ethiopia has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Ethiopia Flood Management Project (EFMP) and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services.

>The consulting services (""the Services"") include the services of carrying out Environmental and Social impact assessment (ESIA) Study for flood protection infrastructure civil works of (Awash. Omo, and Rift Valley Lakes).

>GENERAL OBJECTIVES: The main objective of the consultancy service is to undertake an Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA) for Awash, Omo, and Rift Valley Lakes Basin flood management project to identify environmental and social impacts &
column6: risks which may occur during the construction and operation activities and develop subsequent Environmental and Social Management Plan to address impacts/risks and enhance positive benefits from ET-FMP activities.

column4: >Conduct ESIA and identify impacts (both beneficial and adverse) and-or risks from ET-FMP intervention,

column5: >Recommend measures to avoid, control, mitigate. restore and/or compensate the project's anticipated environmental and social risks and impacts.

>Detail environmental and social requirements in the ESIA and its associated sub-reports and/or plan in particular, to guide the project's final design and its components, including recommendations (design measures) for changes to the project design and specific actions to be taken by contractors and/or subcontractors.

>Prepare an Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA) report, including its subsequent technical sub-reports and a detailed Environmental and Social Management Plan (ESMP) and a monitoring program for the proposed project.

>SCOPE OF SERVICES: The consulting firm shall carry out desktop review and field studies in the project woredas in order to fully describe environmental and social baseline of the project areas. The firm is expected to undertake investigation on social aspects. economic activities, and conservation of natural resources, historical and anthropological heritages, and conduct public consultation and the firm shall identify and describe impacts and associated mitigation measures for the design, construction and operation phases PERSON MONTH &amp
column6: DURATION: It has 9 person-months input within 3 months duration from the end of June 2025.

column1: https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67fcc1b70d17513b5d0a2d91,Uncategorized,Ethiopian Agricultural Transformation Institute (ATI) now invites sealed bids from eligible and qualified bidders to participate in the Supply and delivery of Papaya Seedling (Red lady Variety) - grown by pots and ready for transplanting) for Afar Region,"2:00 P.M. April 28, 2025.","Apr 13, 2025",Addis Ababa,Open,"

column2: >IFB Title: Supply and delivery of Papaya Seedling (Red lady Variety) -grown by pots and ready for transplanting) for Afar Region

>1. The Ethiopian Agricultural Transformation Institute (ATI) is an initiative of the Government of Ethiopia (GOE) established by federal regulation. The formation of the ATI is a result of two years of extensive diagnostic study across eight sub-sectors of Ethiopia's agricultural system in a highly consultative, multi stakeholder process led by the Ministry of Agriculture.
>2. The Institute has funds from GOV-ACC for Supply and delivery of Papaya Seedling (Red lady Variety) - grown by pots and ready for transplanting) for Afar Region.

>3. The Agricultural Transformation Institute now invites sealed bids from eligible and qualified bidders to participate in the Supply and delivery of Papaya Seedling (Red lady Variety) - grown by pots and ready for transplanting) for Afar Region.

>4. Bidding will be conducted in accordance with the open tendering procedures contained in the Public Procurement Proclamation of the Government of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia. Bidding is open to all Bidders from eligible source countries.

>5. A complete set of Bidding Documents in English may be purchased by interested bidders upon payment of a non-refundable fee of Birr 200.00 (Two Hundred Birr) via Commercial Bank of Ethiopia A/C No. 1000517806424 (Original Deposit Slip required).
>6. Bids must be delivered to the address below at or before 2:00 P.M. April 28, 2025. Electronic bidding will not be permitted. Late bids will be rejected.
>7. Bids will be opened in the presence of the bidders' representatives, who choose to attend in person at the address below at 2:30 P.M April 28, 2025.
>8. All bids must be accompanied by a Bid Security ETB 32,000.00 (Thirty Two Thousand Birr) in the form of CPO or unconditional Bank Guarantee.
>9. Bidder should submit a copy of renewed Trade License, VAT Registration certificate, TIN Certificate, Valid Tax Clearance (renewed or not expired), and supplier list from PPA e-GP portal.
>10. The purchaser reserves the right to reject any or all bids.
>11. The Address referred to above is:
>Bole, Off Meskel Flower Road, Adjacent to School of Commerce

column2: >IFB Title: Hiring of IT Consultant for the Customization of African Adaptation Atlas System

>The Ethiopian Agricultural Transformation Institute (ATI) is an initiative of the Government of Ethiopia (GOE) established by federal regulation. ATI is currently engaged in promoting agricultural sector transformation by supporting existing structures of government, the private sector, and other non-governmental partners to address systemic bottlenecks and deliver on a priority national agenda to achieve growth and food security.
>ATI is looking for professional service from reputable consultant to submit proposal (EOI) for the Customization of African Adaptation Atlas System.

>The overall objective of the IT consultant is to deploy and customize the existing application based on the high-level user requirements which will be gathered from stakeholders. The IT consultant is expected to fulfill its mandated objectives stipulated in the TOR which are to be done by reviewing and refining relevant documents, reviewing the existing technologies, and customizing the web application. Anyone interested in this assignment can get the TOR using email address abdeta.mohammed@ati.gov.et .
